loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en: Byambaa is 54 years old and lives with her grandson, a monk, in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Byambaa started her garment sewing business in 1990. Her service is well known and she's a trusted supplier to many shops. Her products are very stylish and of high quality. Now that winter is here, Byambaa is getting a lot of orders; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. Byambaa is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It is hard to replace his late mother. I have to work hard in order to support my grandson."

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.en:
Salvadora is a 56-year-old woman from Lanna, Solana. She is married to a farmer. The couple owns a one-hectare rice field where they cultivate rice to sell as their source of income. Salvadora helps her husband with the farm activities. They have 8 children, four of them students.

Salvadora lacks funds because the profits from her previous sales were used to pay for matriculation fees and the family's daily meals. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, urea (fertilizer) and Magnum (insecticide) used in farming. She hopes to strengthen her business and someday lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Benjamin is the facilitator of the Muungano group. Benjamin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benjamin takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Benjamin had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benjamin was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benjamin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Benjaminn will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Muungano group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Benjamin is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aytolkun

texts.ru: Айтолкун проживает в селе Кара-Суу на севере Кыргызстана, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей, младший сын Эржан проживает вместе и помогает в ведении хозяйства. Благодаря упорному труду семьи Айтолкун, начатый в 1998 году  с 10,000 сом бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве на сегодняшний день насчитывает три дойные коровы, три теленка, двадцать баранов и одну рабочую лошадь. Также на поливной земле  Айтолкун выращивает картофель и фасоль, что позволяет обеспечивать кормовой базой скот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айтолкун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 голов овец. Доходы Айтолкун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Aytolkun lives in the Kara-Suu village in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  She is married and raised five children, the youngest of whom, Erjan, lives together with her and helps with running the business.  Thanks to the family's hard work, their animal husbandry and farming business, which was started with 10,000 som in 1998, currently consists of two dairy cows, three calves, twenty sheep and one work horse.  Aytolkun also grows potatoes and beans on her arable land, and this allows her to provide fodder for the livestock.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase 12 heads of sheep.  Aytolkun plans to invest the profits into further increasing livestock headcount and dreams of building a new house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep

loans.name: Stay Alive Shg Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Stay Alive group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, John had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children and invest in business as savings for the future.

In 2012, the members of Stay Alive SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, John is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her mother and three younger brothers in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Sarantsetseg's brothers attend local universities and high school. 

Sarantsetseg has supported her family for the past six years by operating a beauty salon at the largest outdoor market. When she began her business, she rented one small room; she now rents two rooms and has 3 employees. Sarantsetseg usually offers tattoos, manicures and massages. She takes special care of her employees’ families; therefore, her workers like her and their work. Recently, customers have asked for a tattoo cleaner service. Therefore Sarantsetseg needs a laser machine which refreshes tattoos. 

Sarantsetseg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a tattoo laser machine, which she really needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new tattoo laser machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more land where he can make more bricks.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely and her husband are farmers who live happily in a village. They have owned and managed a rice farming business for almost eight years, usually earning a profit of PHP 23,000 every harvest season. They plan to increase their yields and income to continuously send their children to school and satisfy their daily basic necessities. Although farming is difficult to manage, they have the strong faith and determination to achieve their goals. They have the patience to endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life.

Nely is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs required for rice farming. She and her husband believe that their patience and sacrifices will bear a fruitful harvest and that all their plans will become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Shaheen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen bibi, 26 years old, is a kind and responsible woman. She is married and lives with her family and three children, 7, 5 and 3 years old. Shaheen’s days are focused on managing the progress of her home-based decorative embroidery business. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which helps to attract many customers in her community.

Shaheen bibi's husband has owned a barber shop for the past 10 years. He has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is becoming well known in his area. He will use this loan to purchase chairs to provide better seating arrangements, scissors and beauty products (face creams, masks, etc.) for his barber shop. Shaheen is hopeful that her husband will be able to gain more profits after the loan investment and to provide a better life to the family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy chairs, scissors and beauty products

loans.name: Sopheakdey

texts.en:
Sopheakdey and his wife, Sreyrath, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters who are in school. 

Sopheakdey operates business designing windows and doors with mirrors. In the past, he used to be a driver. His wife now stays at home and does housework. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy additional materials needs in his business. He will use the loan to buy mirrors.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for his business.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар проживает в районе Кумсангир. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 10 детей. У него среднее образование. Его сын находится и работает в России. Сам Акбар зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Akbar lives in Qumsangir.  He is 48 years old, married, and has ten children. He has a secondary education. His son lives and works in Russia. Akbar makes a living by breeding cattle. He's been doing this for eight years. He is taking out a loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy two cows and some steers

loans.name: Ovuluhya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ovuluhya SHG Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Ovuluhya SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Ovuluhya SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chekalini Central Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chekalini Central Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robai and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Robai is the facilitator of the Chekalini Central Group. The photograph shows Robai with her group members. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Chekalini Central Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Robai takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Robai had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Robai was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Robai will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khuyete S H G Group

texts.en:
Joel is the father of four children. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Joel will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

Joel is the facilitator of the Khuyete SHG group. He is pictured with his group members in the photograph. Joel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Khuyete SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en:
Doeurn (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons and two daughters. Five are married and live in separated homes and another one is a garment worker.  

Doeurn is a weaver. Her husband is a disabled person. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is a 39-year-old widowed mother with three children who are still in school. She is a farmer who has been farming for ten years. For the past three years she has supplemented her income by working at an ice factory. In addition, she raises poultry including chickens and ducks. She is currently able to earn about three U.S. dollars a day to feed her children.

Sokkhoeun leads a group made up of three females. She and one of her group have been with VisionFund since 2010 while the third member has just joined VisionFund. Her first loan from VisionFund helped her to have regular income, to purchase some basic household necessities and send her children to school. 

She is requesting a loan partly to pay for harvesting and partly to purchase feed for her chicken and ducks. The loan will allow her to finish harvesting her rice and also feed her chicken and ducks enough so that they will become fat. This will enable her to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and buy feed for her poultry.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 38 years old and has nine children between the ages of five and seventeen. All of them are currently in school. 

Claudine sells foodstuffs such as tomatoes in a store she has run for a year. Claudine would like a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell. The profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato started to cultivate a hectare plot of land since he was 18. He grows rice to sell. The income from this business helps provide needs of his younger sister still in her studies. He has sacrificed not to enter into college anymore in giving way for his sister. Renato is now 21 years old. Though he only finished high school, he finds a way to help his parents gain an income.

He had an insufficient fund now so he would like to ask for P25,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers. He would like to improve his corn production so that he can really help educate his sister.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rock

texts.en:
Rock is a 31-year-old single man, who opened a small bakery ten years ago. 

Rock makes a very tasty Mankousheh, is a popular  food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat, similar to a pizza, it can be sliced or folded, and it can either be served for breakfast or lunch.

Rock is very talented person, and his business is improving because of the tasty products he makes. His bakery is located next to an army barracks and he wants to be capable of supplying the huge number of orders he gets from soldiers in addition to his usual daily customers. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy extra raw materials and new machines which will allow him to respond to demand. 

Rock is a hard worker who seeks perfection in his business. In addition to his bakery he hopes to expand his business by opening a special snack shop where he can serve specially-made sandwiches.

loans.use: To buy machinery and raw materials to develop his business.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (pictured above) has been selling vegetables and meat in the local market for more than six years. Her husband, Moeun has been selling cows for more than three years. He buys cows from his village and sells them in other districts far away from his house. Sometimes, there is a middleman comes to buy cows at his home. Sophea is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s business buying and sale cows. He will use the loan to continue his business by buying additional cows for resale.

The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and have two sons and one daughter-whom are in school.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s business buying and sale cows.

loans.name: Niven

texts.en:
Niven is a 26-year-old, single woman from Ramallah. 

On January 1st, 2011, together with a partner, Niven opened a salon for women. She would like to have her own salon, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to have her own salon.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is 25 years old with one child, aged three. Salama has been selling utensils for three years. She would like a loan to increase the types of utensils she can sell. The profits will be used to increase her savings and eventually to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru: Сайёра проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 41 год. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сайёра занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает яблоки. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Sayyora lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 41 years old, divorced and has one child.  Sayyora is involved in sales.  She primarily sells apples and has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, tangerines and oranges

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert simply lives in their community with his wife and three children. He is 46 years old, an industrious husband wherein he manages his farming business for more than ten years. This is their source of income where he usually gets the expenses used in the education of his three children. So he wants to improve more his business. For this reason, he is asking a loan amount P25,000 to purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers that would be used in his corn field in order to yield a better crop by the next cropping season. 


He hopes to gain much crops to provide the needs of his family. Through his hard work and patience to work every day in his business, he knows that there is hope for him to achieve better living.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Corner Nzuri C Group

texts.en:
Berneta joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Berneta had a good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Berneta was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Berneta will invest in her business and and educate her children.

Berneta is the facilitator of the Corner Nzuri C Group. The photograph shows Berneta with her group members. Berneta and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Corner Nzuri C Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Berneta and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, 57 years old, is married and lives with her family: her husband and five children, all involved in different types of work. Her sons are barbers by profession while her daughters are involved in sewing. They all contribute to the family financially from their earnings. Salma’s days are focused on managing the household chores. She is a very caring lady and takes good care of her family.

Salma's husband has been involved in a shoemaking business for over 20 years. He makes traditional shoes called khussa in the Urdu language. Khussa is a very famous product and people love wearing them. He makes simple and embroidered khussas for his customers on demand. Salma's husband will use this loan to purchase embroidery material and leather in larger quantities to be able to make many more khussas to sell. Salma is hopeful that his business will bring in a good revenue after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, Salma is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy embroidery material and leather

loans.name: Silence

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Silence from Chitungwiza, a densely populated city in Zimbabwe, 30km from Harare. He is single with no children, but he takes care of his mother and his three sisters who are still at school.

Silence runs a manufacturing business making new shoes and sandals. The business has been in operation for two years. He says that his main challenge is the distance he has to travel to get the materials he needs to make his products. 

Silence has requested a loan of $500 to buy rubber, leather, twine and glue. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to  pay school fees for his three sisters and look after his mother. In the future Silence plans to open workshops in other districts of Harare.

loans.use: to buy materials such as rubber, leather, twine and glue to make shoes.

loans.name: Naayem

texts.en:
Naayem is a 66-year-old married woman who has worked as a tailor for the past four years. Her house is her business center, and most of her customers feel comfortable going there to make their requests.

Naayem is a hardworking woman. She is proud that she's capable of helping her husband to improve their standard of living. That's why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new machine necessary to improve the quality of her products and increase her productivity in a very short period of time.

Naayem will also invest part of the loan to help her son pay for his wedding as her gift to him.

She is very happy and anxious to take the loan, and hopes to expand her business more as well as to open her own atelier in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Regis

texts.en: Regis is 19 years old and has one child, age 2. She sells shoes, which she has been doing for five years. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for sale. Any profits will be used to build a house for her family. She would eventually like to become a wholesaler of used shoes.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Masasuli S H G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Masasuli SHG Group in Western Kenya! 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rebecca and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Rebecca is the facilitator of the Masasuli SHG Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Masasuli SHG Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Rebecca takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rebecca had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Rebecca was only able to harvest 14 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Rebecca will educate her children.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nurinsa

texts.ru:
Нуринсе  48 лет, воспитывает  двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Нуринса начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 2,000 сом (KGS).   
Благодаря упорному труду Нуринсы, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает четыре дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуринса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Нуринса планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Nurinsa is 48 years old and is raising two children. Her husband is located abroad working in Russia. In searching for a source of funding for her family, Nurinsa started her business in cattle fattening and resale ten years ago, using a starting amount of 2,000 som (KGS). Through the hard work of Nurinsa, her household today has four milking cows. In order to further develop her business, Nurinsa asked the company «Bai-Tushum and Partners» for a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. With her profits, Nurinsa plans to invest further in livestock and in the future hopes to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
45-year-old Lourdes is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for 10 years. Lourdes primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns 4000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Lourdes has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Lourdes hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her two children, who are 18 and 10 years old, to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en: Majdi is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza. In 2005, Majdi opened his own cafeteria. He now hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy new décor and furniture for his cafeteria because it will grab his customers' attention and bring in a larger amount of customers. He hopes that this will increase his income as well.

loans.use: to buy new décor and furniture for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish, chicken pieces, and eggs

loans.name: Ulamnemeh

texts.en:
Ulamnemeh is 58 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with income from her business, their eldest three children are employed, and the youngest one is a college student. 

Ulamnemeh started his food-cart business in 2009. Now that he has run his business for several years, he has many regular customers. During the winter, the meat prices will increase as usual. To avoid the increased prices, he wants to buy meat worth 2,500,000 MNT. 

He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "If I don't buy meat now, I could lose a lot of customers and I couldn't pay my daughter's college fee.”

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Marakaru B Group

texts.en:
Jackline takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, she will build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

Jackline is the facilitator of the Marakaru B Group. Jackline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Marakaru B Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackoine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cows and airtime recharge cards

loans.name: Shivembe Shg Group

texts.en:
Daniel is the facilitator of the Shivembe SHG group. Daniel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daniel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Daniel takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Daniel had a good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Daniel was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Daniel will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Shivembe SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Daniel with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy planks, boards, and nails

loans.name: Gonchig

texts.en:
Gonchig is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife is a school teacher and his son is a kindergarten student. 

He started his raw materials (wool, cashmere) trading business in 2006. He travels to rural areas to collect his raw materials. He has many trusted suppliers.
 
Now that winter is approaching, he needs support to collect his raw materials. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Now is the peak season for my business. It is the only season I make most of my money". 

He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (wool, cashmere).

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is 39 years old and is married with four children. She runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol, where she sells various items such as vinegar, spices, shampoo, and soap. Norberta works hard to improve her business and support her husband to provide for their needs.

Norberta is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, and rice. She hopes that her business will grow and she also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, and rice

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt is a 47-year-old man who lives with his family in an outer ger (Mongolian yurt) district without basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He has a son who attends university and a daughter who is a kindergarten teacher. His wife works at a pre-school while he works at a local non-governmental organization. 

His daughter’s marriage will be held this winter, so he needs to do some renovation work in the house in which his family currently lives.  He is planning to install a parquetry floor and redo the ceiling. He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase essential construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 29 years old and is married. She has two children between the ages of 2 and 4 years old. Her business is well clean and good. She sells fish in the market. Josiane has three years experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business operates from 7am until 8pm every day.

Josiane has requested a loan from Kiva lender (via vision finance company) in order to purchase more, larger quantities of fish. With this profit from the loan, Josiane will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocita

texts.en:
Since she was 43 years old, Jocita aimed to improve her small eatery to increase her income and support the education of her three children.  She and her husband agreed to continue sending their children to school, for they want each of them to earn a degree and find a good job someday. Despite financial difficulty, they have the confidence to work out their plans and believe that nothing is impossible if they work hard and strive more.
 
Jocita wants to ask for additional capital of P9,000 to be used in buying needed ingredients like vegetables, pork, fish, chicken meat, oils and seasonings to cook and sell in her food stall. 

She believes that through this loan, she will be able to cook more recipes and satisfy her customers' demand. She hopes that she will make her business grow and that it will become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, pork, fish, chicken meat, oils and seasonings needed in cooking food for sale.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon is 43 years old and his wife, Mit, is 44 years old. They live in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have three sons and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives in a separate home, one is a garment worker, and the other two are in school.

Muon and his wife have been farming for ten years. They grow vegetables. Muon is asking for his first loan in the amount of $700 in order to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

Photo: Muon is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 32-year-old single man. He is known for his relentless determination to provide a comfortable standard of living in hopes of starting a small family in the near future. Rami owns a laundry, and he also specializes in repairing clothes with the help of a specialized sewing machine.

Rami is a very optimistic and ambitious man. He aspires to improve his business by buying a more technically advanced sewing machine, so he is requesting  a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Rami has a good reputation, and he is well-known for treating his clients well and for providing good service in the market and with traders. He inherited this business from his dad when he was 13 years old, so he has extensive experience in the field.

Rami is a hopeful man and he believes that, with the help of the loan and his abilities, he will be able to expand his business and open another branch of his laundry in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nambalai Farmers Group

texts.en:
Boniface is the facilitator of the Nambalai Farmers group. Boniface and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Boniface takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Boniface had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Boniface was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Boniface and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Boniface will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nambalai Farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Roseline is the facilitator of the Amani group. Roseline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roseline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Roseline takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and secure enough food for her children. In the recent 2011 season, Roseline had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roseline was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Roseline will educate her children and save in business and livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Amani group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Roseline is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She started her traditional boot making business in 2009. Her husband helps with her business. Amarjargal learned boot making from her father. Her boots are stylish and well-made so the demand is increasing. 

Amarjargal is requesting a loan for 600,000 MNT, which she will use to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en:
Vanney is 47 years old, married, and has six children. Two of her children are midwives, two are soldiers, and two attend school. She lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Vanney is a farmer, while her husband works for the Ministry of National Defense. She is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to the hospital where she is a midwife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Fayaremu A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Fayaremu A Group in Western Kenya! Roseline is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Roseline takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roseline had a very good maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roseline was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roseline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Roseline will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Fayaremu A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en: Tumenjargal is 55 years old and married.  She lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia.  She started her food cart business in 2000. Her husband helps with her business. She has many regular customers. During the winter, the meat prices will increase as usual so Tumenjargal is requesting a loan for 400,000 MNT, which she will use to buy meat now.  By doing so, she believes that she will not lose her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Poy is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Krong Siem Reap and cultivates rice crops. She also makes bamboo baskets, earning a profit of $5.00 a day. Poy’s husband is a construction worker who often moves from place to place with his team. 

Poy is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband to use to travel to his workplace. Her future goal is to own a general store in a local market.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en: Sakina (left) is a housewife as well as a working lady who sells clothes to her community clients. She purchases these clothes from wholesale market and sells them at a profit. She is 46 years old and has a 10-year-old son who is studying in class 4th. Her husband is a daily wage laborer who works for a low income. Her brother also lives with her and sells vegetables. The quality of the vegetables he sells is very good that’s why he makes good sales everyday. Sakina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her brother’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling on profits. He is very hard worker and Sakina is confident about his business success after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy fresh seaonal vegetables for her brother's vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en: Sugran (right) is 49, married, and lives with her family including five children. Her two older children work while the other three are getting their education in school. Sugran’s days are focused on managing her artificial jewelry business. She sells jewelry to different shops and to her community members who she serves with good products. She has been operating her business for over 10 years.  Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling fruit. He buys fruit from the fruit markets in bulk by visiting early in the morning and then sells to his customers. He is a very hard worker. He always sells fresh quality fruits to the customers and never compromises on quality. For his sincere thought and quality fruit, he makes good sales and earns better profits. With this loan, Sugran will buy artificial jewelry such as necklaces, ear-rings, and bangles in bulk to be able to fulfill customers' demands on time and so generate more revenue. She is expecting to make good saving from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry for re-selling

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 37-year-old married woman, the mother of two beautiful, smart children. Nine years ago, she opened a clothing shop after working as a teacher for some time.

Khalida has worked hard to establish her own business. She accepted the challenge of this courageous step forward in order to earn more income and to give her children a better standard of living than what she could provide as a teacher. She is happy that she's capable of helping her husband earn income and meet their expenses.

To take another step forward, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to expand her selection of merchandise with special new autumn and winter collections. This is Khalida's first experience with Kiva, and she hopes it will be a very exciting and impressive one that will lead to future expansion, such as opening a new branch or starting a wholesale business.

loans.use: to add autumn and winter collections to her inventory.

loans.name: Umoja Shg Group

texts.en:
Paul is the facilitator of the Umoja SHG group. Paul and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Paul takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Paul will educate his children and invest in business and livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Paul is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jisaidie Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jisaidie Group in Western Kenya! Netty is the facilitator of the Jisaidie group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Netty takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Netty had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Netty was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Netty  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Netty will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Jisaidie group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Panina

texts.en:
Panina is a divorced mother of two from northern Israel. She began running a cosmetics business from her home. Panina took cosmetology courses from her local college and is determined to provide a secure future for her family. Panina has created a lovely salon in her home. From the start she has garnered clients who are pleased with her work and bring her other customers.

Panina has the opportunity to expand her business and develop larger income. In order to do so she needs additional equipment and supplies to expand her salon. The loan is being used to purchase cosmetics, equipment and supplies.

Panina dreams of expanding her enterprise and creating a salon which promises economic security to her and her children. She wants to provide her children with a strong, healthy future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en: Kaneez (left) supports her family by sewing. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s transport business. With the loan investment, he will buy new tires for his vehicle that will allow him drive it more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. He drives his vehicle very safely and works very hard to support his family. Kaneez is hopeful that a loan will help him make more profits. With the improved business of her son, she will be able to save some profits every month for his marriage as he is now 32 years of age.

loans.use: To buy new tires for her son's transport business

loans.name: Buhbat

texts.en: Buhbat is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His oldest child is a school student and the younger two are in kindergarden. He started his firewood-preparing business in 2009 at home with his own saw. His saw is industrial and powerfull but unfortunately it needs some parts to be replaced. He is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy parts of the saw. He is a sharp and diligent man who says "It is now peak season for my business but my saw is not working. My family is having a crisis"

loans.use: To buy parts for his industrial saw

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a nice and responsible woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Elma only finished her high school education and then got married at a young age. She then got involved in rice farming as a source of income. She helped her husband transplant rice seedlings and learned a lot about this business. With the profits earned from the business, she was able to support her family's needs for meals and also pays for tuition fees for her children who are still in elementary grade.

Elma would like to further improve her crop porduction but she is limited financially to buy inputs. In this regard, she is now asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy 15 bags of fertilizers for use in farming. In the future, Elma would like to keep producing better crops to ensure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizers for use in farming

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband works as a driver and farmer.

Anita and her husband are farmers, working together to till their land and grow rice crops. According to Anita, their farming business earns them 8000 PHP (Philippine pesos) per month.

Anita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and feed. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and feed.

loans.name: Su

texts.en: Su is 54 years old and has three married children. She grows rice and has been raising chickens for three years, earning a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. Su has participated in SEDA since 2008 and is a member of the An Tap cluster. For her last loan, Su borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for the chickens she raises.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, a 38-year-old farmer, wants to increase his income in the next harvesting season, and so is requesting a loan of P15,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Alex hopes to increase his income in order to finance the education of his five children so that they can one day earn degrees and therefore have better opportunities in life than he has had.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for use in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to use as capital to buy recycled materials from the villagers.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (yurt) in the Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband is a plumber. Both of her children attend school with her eldest child in college. She started her grocery retail business in 1997 by renting a counter in a market. She is a respected businesswoman in the market. Over the years, she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Her business income has been relatively the same ever since she started her business. She expanded her business by renting one more counter in the market. However, she is lacking supplies to run the counter. Therefore, she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "Things are getting pretty tight since my son joined college. I have to [do] everything I can in order to support my child."

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery counter in the market.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 33-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. For three years, she has had a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of items like shampoo, soap, canned goods, and soft drinks. Julie earns 4000 PHP (Philippine pesos) per month with her sari-sari store business. Julie's husband is a farmer and fish vendor. She helps him grow rice on their land.

Julie has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods. Julie hopes to earn more and therefore to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm and more items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он продает яблоки, виноград и гранат. В этой области он десять лет. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Султон берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sulton is engaged in trade in the market. In general, he sells apples, grapes and pomegranates. He has spent ten years in this area. He is 43 years old. He is married and has five children. Sulton is taking a loan in order to increase his product turnover.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Rafiki Shg Group

texts.en:
Ernest is the facilitator of the Rafiki SHG group. Ernest and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ernest and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Ernest takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Ernest had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ernest was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Ernest will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Rafiki SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Ernest is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vumilia Self Help Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vumilia Self Help Group in Western Kenya! Margaret is the facilitator of the Vumilia Self Help group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia Self Help group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 21-year-old married man. He has been working as a butcher for nine years. Omar was only 12 years old when he started working. Because of his parents' bad financial situation, he had to be a productive contributor to the family's income.

Omar opened his own butcher shop in 2006. He is ambitious and a hard worker who has struggled to improve his standard of living. He also has a beautiful family, which he plans to expand after developing his business to ensure that his children won't face the same miserable childhood he had.

Omar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new updated and improved models of the machines his business requires. He will also try to perform some necessary maintenance on his shop.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his business.

loans.name: Melche

texts.en:
Melche, a a 24-year-old married mother of two who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family, earns a living selling fruit salad to her community, while her husband runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. Together, they work hard to provide for their needs and save for the future.

Melche has requested a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and raw ingredients for making fruit salad. She hopes for her and her husband's businesses to grow, and also hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and raw ingredients for making fruit salad.

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel, a 27-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol, is married to a farmer. Licel has had a sari-sari store business for five years, selling various items including soy sauce, vinegar, soap, shampoo and canned goods. She also assists her husband in planting rice on their land.

Licel, who does her best to support her family, is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and additional items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. She hopes for this loan to help their businesses and family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village of Atskvita in the southern part of the country. He is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife Tiniko and his 75-year-old father. David runs the family's agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where they grow potatoes and raise milk cows for producing cheese. The potatoes and cheese are sold in a grocery store Tiniko runs. She purchases grocery products in nearby towns at wholesale prices and sells them in the family's store in their village. The family's total average monthly income is 700 laris, including David’s father's monthly pension.

David has requested a loan to increase the store's stocks. A larger variety of products will attract additional clients to the store, and sales will increase, therefore increasing the family's income. David and Tiniko plan to use the additional revenue to renovate their house, which is old and in bad condition.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina, a 54-year-old lady, is married and lives with her family: a husband and six children. Except for her eldest son, all of her children attend a local school.
 
Rubina’s days are spent managing the household chores. She loves taking care of her family and cooking delicious food for them. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.

Unfortunately, her husband is currently unemployed. In order to support himself financially and manage the household expenses, her eldest son operates a transportation business. He has a horse cart, which he uses to take people to their destinations and sometimes to transport loads. He has been in this business for the past six years. 

Rubina has requested a loan to purchase a new horse cart because her son's old cart has become rough and rotten in some spots. She is hopeful that her son's business will be improved a lot due to the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rubina.

loans.use: to buy a new horse cart.

loans.name: Saidbako

texts.ru: Саидбако женат и имеет четверых детей. Он целеустремленный и ответственный человек. Саидбако занимается купле- продажей скота, и содержит их дома. Он имеет землю, на  которой трудится допоздна. На земле он выращивает картофель и зерно. Отходы от урожая идут на корм скота и содержит их за счет этого. Саидбако хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. От полученной прибыли он хочет благоустроить свой дом. Саидбако хотел бы получить займ для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота, а на остальную сумму хочет посеять пшеницу, ячмень и картофель.
texts.en:
Saidbako is married and has four children. He is a purposeful and responsible person. Saidbako is engaged in the buying and selling of livestock and takes care of them at his home. He has land on which he works late into the night. On his land he grows potatoes and corn. Excess from the harvest goes to feed livestock and he supports them in this manner. Saidbako wants to grow his business and make a good profit. With the profits, he wants to do landscaping at his home. 

Saidbako would like to receive a loan in order to buy three heads of cattle and to use the remaining money to sow wheat, barley, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Ikolomani W.g Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Ikolomani W. group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had a good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Violet will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Ikolomani W. group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Violet is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sabiba

texts.ru: Сабиба занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже год. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Sabiba does sales of children's clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for one year. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Sabiba is taking out the loan to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Group in Western Kenya! John is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

John takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, John had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is 29 years old. He is married to a housewife and has two children. When Rafael was young, he helped his father plow his rice field and transplant seedlings. Today he applies his extensive experience in farming on his own land. He wants to ensure a good harvest so he works hard in the field every day.

Because of insufficient funds, Rafael is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy five bags of urea (a fertilizer) and two liters of Karate (a pesticide) to help sustain his crops.

Rafael aims to save enough money to send his children to college someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Masasuli Shg B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Masasuli SHG B Group in Western Kenya! Neddy is the facilitator of the Masasuli SHG B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Neddy takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Neddy had a good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Neddy was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Neddy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Neddy will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Masasuli SHG B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Neddy and her group with the field officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 31, has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She sells various items like oil, vinegar, soap, shampoo and canned goods. Rowena earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She said her store is really helpful in providing for her family's daily needs.

Rowena requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods and noodles. She hopes for her business to grow and for her two children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 46 years old, and she has two children. In addition to growing rice, she sells fruit in the market and breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. 

Lan has participated in SEDA since 2008. She previously borrowed 8,288,000 VND, which she repaid punctually. She would now like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old married to Sammy who helps to support his family. They have been blessed with one child who is one year old. 

Beatrice runs a boutique and she has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 10,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 40,000 that she will use to open another boutique. This is her fourth loan and she successfully paid her previous loan well and in good time. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To open another boutique.

loans.name: Mulembe Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulembe Group in Western Kenya! Catherine is the facilitator of the Mulembe group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Catherine takes care of 6 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Catherine had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Catherine was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Catherine  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Catherine will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Mulembe group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: The photograph shows 6 people; 4 women and 2 men, with animals reared.

loans.name: Ajibay

texts.ru: Ажибаю 49 лет, женат, воспитывает четверых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Ажибай начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Ажибая, начатое с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Ажибай обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов. Доходы от кредита Ажибай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ajibay is 49 years old, he is married and is raising four children.  In search of income for his family, in 2006 Ajibay started his business of fattening and reselling livestock.  Thanks to Ajibay's tenacity and perseverance his holdings, started with 15,000 Som (KGS), today bring in around 7,000 Som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  With the goal of further increasing his livestock count, Ajibay turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners company for a loan of 30,000 Som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep.  Ajibay plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing his livestock count.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 49, is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has a 23-year-old child.

Gemma is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Gemma also sells feeds, fertilizers and gasoline to her community. She does her best to improve her family income.

Gemma has requested a loan to buy more feeds, fertilizers and gasoline to sell. Gemma hopes to continue supporting her family financially. She also plans to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more feeds, fertilizers and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Yawezekana Group

texts.en:
Shadrack is the facilitator of the Yawezekana group. Shadrack and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Shadrack takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Shadrack had a good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Shadrack was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Shadrack and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Shadrack will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Yawezekana group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia has a sari-sari (variety) store business located in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a welder.

Gorgonia sells various items like soap, vinegar and canned goods in her community. She works hard to help sustain her family. She applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as detergent soap, canned goods and bread. 

Gorgonia hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as detergent soap, canned goods and bread.

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is 40 years old, married, and lives with her family: a husband and seven children. Three of her children work while the other four are being educated at a local school. 

Naziran’s days are focused on managing her household chores. She spends her time at home and takes care of her family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.

Her husband earns a living from his spare parts business. He has been in this business for over three years, and during this short time, he has developed a good reputation among his customers for his good products and respectful behavior.

With this loan, her husband will purchase spare parts for different vehicles to resell. Naziran is hopeful that her husband’s business will be better-established with this loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naziran.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 41 years old, and he operates a farming business in his village. He lives a simple life with his wife and two children. Every day, he goes into the field and spends all of his time working. Despite the difficulties of farming, he has the courage to persist in earning his family's income. 

Danilo is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his corn field. He hopes that, in the coming season, he will produce better crops in order to save for his family as well as his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Она занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Дилафруз хочет создать уют и все условия в своем доме и для этого работает усердно. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1000 Сомони для покупки двух голов овец. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Dilafruz is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She raises livestock and grows agricultural products.  She would like to expand her business and earn a good profit.  Dilafruz would like to create comfort and a good environment in her home and works diligently for this.  She would like to receive a loan of 1000 Somoni for the purchase of two sheep.  She hopes for your help and is grateful to you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase barber shop equipment like shaving machines. He also plans on expanding his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a vegetable gardener. She grows "pechay" (chinese cabbage) and other kinds of vegetables. Fe sells her harvest to her community. She also sells eggs and soft drinks. Fe earns 700 PHP per day with her business.

Fe is requesting a loan to buy seeds and more items to sell such as eggs and soft drinks. Fe hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to help sustain her family of a husband and three children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and more items to sell such as eggs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anick Zinhoue

texts.fr: Anick, femme dynamique, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de sous vêtements, chemises, produits cosmétiques, tapettes  sise au marché Vèdoko, activité qu'elle maîtrise au vue de son expérience. Elle s'approvisionne au Togo aussi bien qu'au Bénin en gros pour revendre en détail. Compte tenu de son emplacement dans le marché et en vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises et de maximiser son profit pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en: Anick, who is a dynamic woman, is married and mother to two children. She specialises in the sale of underwear, shirts, cosmetics and flip-flops in the Védoko market, and given her experience, masters this business well. She gets her supplies wholesale in Togo as well as in Benin and resells them on a retail basis. In view of her location in the market and in order to satisfy her customers' needs, she is requesting a micro-loan from Finadev in order to build up her stock of goods and maximise her profits for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 20 shirts, 20 pairs of flip-flops, 30 cosmetic products, and with the remainder of the money, other clothing.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
