Marcial is a farmer who has been raising crops for almost 20 years. Despite his farming experience, he aspires to better yields. He is married and has two children who are in high school. The inputs he needs to improve his crops are expensive, and he lacks funds. He is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy rice seeds and eight sacks of fertilizer for his farm.

Someday he would like to earn enough money to send his children to college while supporting the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Umoja Farmers B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja Farmers B Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Umoja Farmers B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Mary takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Mary will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Umoja Farmers B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is very supportive, sewing clothes to assist her husband financially. She is very fond of sewing, and she can make different styles of clothes for very reasonable prices. Bilqees is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son sells clothes while her daughter is studying in the ninth grade. Her husband operates a grocery store in the market where he sells everyday items such as salt, sugar, and spices.

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s grocery business. With the loan, he will buy spices, sugar, cooking oil, snacks, and other items to fulfill the needs of his customers and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business, and Bilqees is confident that the investment will increase his productivity, sales, and profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: to buy products for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been running a retail shop for the last three years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. He is 37 years old and married to Eunice. They have three children.

He has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, sweets and tea leaves for sale.

The anticipated profits he will save to provide the basic needs for his family. Andrew hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop in the future

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, sweets and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Maharagwe A W Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Maharagwe A W. group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Beatrice takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her  family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Maharagwe A W. group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 58-year-old married woman with with children. 

She has been engaged in farming for six years. Nida primarily grows rice crops to sell. Nida earns 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming. She works hard to support her family financially.

Nida has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Nida hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. For now, she hopes to continue earning and be able to pay her obligations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Timothy is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Timothy and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Timothy takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Timothy had a good maize yield, harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Timothy was only able to harvest 1 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Timothy and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Timothy will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The picture shows Timothy and his group with the field officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est une femme mariée agée de 54 ans  mère de 6 enfants et 3 autres qui lui sont confiés.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 02/08/2008 ou elle occupe actuellement le poste de présidente.
Awa fait parti du groupe de solidarité takku liguey.

Son activité génératrice de revenu reste le commerce dans la vente de petit déjeuner (restauration) une activité qu elle maitrise bien pour l avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.

Son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs Cfa lui permettra de financer son activité de restauration en achetant du pain des haricots du sucre du lait ...

Les bénéfices qu'elle aura réalisé lui permettront de payer la scolarité de ses enfants mais également de payer des ordonnances pour ses enfants en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Awa is 54 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is also taking care of 3 more. She is the president of the Banc Villageois and has been a member since August 2nd, 2008. She is also a member of the solidarity group Takku Liguey.

Awa is an experienced restaurateur and has been earning a living selling breakfasts for a long time. She will use the loan of 500 000 francs to buy the ingredients she needs to make the breakfasts, such as bread, beans, sugar and milk. 

Awa will use her profits to pay for her children´s education and for any medical bills they may incur.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as bread, beans, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer.

Ponciana has been in the business of raising pigs for seven years. She earns 6,000 PHP each month. 

Ponciana also helps grow rice crops when she can.

Ponciana plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed, vitamins and fertilizers. Ponciana works hard to support her family and help improve their living conditions.

This loan will help Ponciana and her husband with their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, vitamins and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kimuga W.g Group

texts.en:
Angeline is the facilitator of the Kimuga W. group. Angeline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Angeline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Angeline joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Angeline had a good maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Angeline was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Angeline will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kimuga W. group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Angeline with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson  is 33 years old and married to Mary, who runs a green grocer. They have two children.

He has been selling spare parts for the last ten years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES. 20,000.  

He has applied for his first loan of  KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock of spare parts such as headlights, side mirrors and back lights for sale.

He will save the anticipated profits to provide the basic needs for his family. 

Benson hopes to grow his business and open a big wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts such as headlights, side mirrors and back lights for sale.

loans.name: Jean Paul 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est crée depuis le démarrage du banc villageois.
 Il est composé de 15 femmes, habitant dans le même village. Elles pratiquent comme activité l'embouche ovine et caprine.
Mame Diarra (debout à droite de la photo) est la responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Les 8 enfants de sa coepouse sont aussi à son charge.
Elle fait de l'embouche, une activité qu'elle maitrise parfaitement pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.
Son prêt reçu lui permet d'acheter des brebis et des caprins pour les élever et au bout de 6 mois les vendre.
Ses recettes lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Jean Paul 2 group was created at the same time as the inauguration of the Banc Villageois. The group is made up of 15 women who all live in the same village. The women are all engaged in sheep and goat fattening.

Diarra (standing on the far right of the picture) is the group´s leader. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also taking care of her co-wife´s 8 children.

Diarra has been practising animal fattening for many years and is very experienced in this area. This loan enables her to buy some sheep and goats so that she can fatten them for 6 months before selling them. Her income will allow her to take care of her children´s needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional brick laying equipment.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is from Vale in southwest Georgia. He is 40 years old and married. He lives with his family: his wife, Lali, and his 5-year-old daughter. Kakha earns a living through family agricultural activities. In particular, the family owns 0.75 hectares of land, where cabbage and potatoes are grown. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to greengrocers. Along with the abovementioned, the family has two milk cows, two calves, and a pig. Kakha and Lali produce cheese, which is sold on the local open market. Also, the family sells on average 10 piglets per year in the village.

Kakha requested a loan to purchase calves. After a half year, the purchased calves will become milk cows. Kakha and Lali will have more milk for cheese production. They will increase sales of cheese. It will positively impact the income of the family. The family plans to reinvest the increased income in further development of the family farm, in order to expand it and to increase the profitability.

loans.use: to purchase calves for expansion of his dairy farm.

loans.name: Mbogoyif Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 17/04/ 2010.IL est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village. Elles ont pour responsable Yandé. Sur la photo elle est placée à l'extrême droite.
Elle est âgée de 44 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a en charge aussi 1 neveu et 4 nièces.

Elle fait du commerce de mil et de légumes. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (mil et légumes)

Ses recettes lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins quotidiens de ses enfants tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The Mbogoyif group was created on April 17th, 2010, and is made up of 14 women who all come from the same village. The group´s leader is Yandé, who is standing on the far of the picture.

Yandé is 44 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is also taking care of one nephew and 4 nieces. She sells millet and vegetables and is a seasoned saleswoman with several years experience.

Yandé will use this loan to buy millet and vegetables for resale. She will use her earnings to take care of her children´s needs and build up her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy millet and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sango Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sango SHG Group in Western Kenya! Loice is the facilitator of the Sango SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Loice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Loice had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Loice was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Loice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Loice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sango SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a clothes sewing expert. She knows about the latest trends in fashion and can prepare beautiful looking clothes. She charges 150 PKR for a simple dress and 200 PKR for a designer dress. Her husband makes shoes. He is an expert in his field of work and receives a good number of orders every month.

Sakina is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.

Sakina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further expand her husband's shoemaking business. With the loan investment, he will buy shoelaces and leather in large quantities, which will help him to complete orders on time and to increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Sakina is hopeful that after investment, it will grow further.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding the book, Asasah Passbook, is Sakina.

loans.use: to buy shoelaces and leather to expand her husband's shoemaking business.

loans.name: Hermilo

texts.en:
Hermilo is a 55-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 2 children, ages 18 and 16.

Hermilo is able to provide for his family through fishing. Each month, Hermilo earns 7,000 PHP with his business. He plans to use his loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and gasoline for the boat. Hermilo hopes for this loan to help improve his business. He plans to make improvements to their house once his income improves.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and gasoline for the boat

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
From Pouk district, Siem Reap province, Mrs. Sorm, 37, a loving mother of 2 school-aged children, is in the business of selling fish, cultivating rice crops and making several kinds of Khmer cake. Her husband is the one who catches fish for her from Tonle Sap River. Typically, she is able to earn an income in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day.  

With this loan, Mrs. Sorm will buy additional fish, which can be dried, and will buy rice seeds for growing in a new season. She is hopeful to improve her businesses and gain more income through using this loan from HKL.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and rice seeds for growing in a new season.

loans.name: Gullu

texts.ru:
Gullu yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Gullu zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Yeyo deti pomogayut svoyey mame po rabote. Gullu 48 let. 
Ona ochen nujdayetsya V 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya togo chtob uvelichit kolichestvo molochnogo produkta, tak kak ona xochet uvelichit svoy mesachniy doxot. 
Gullu uje  8 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey teti kotoraya toje zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Gullu prodayot molochniye produkti v magazini.
texts.en:
Gullu is an internally displaced person (IDP) and has been relocated from the town of Fuzuli, she now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Gullu is married and has three children. Her children help their mother with the business. Gullu is 48 years old.

She very much needs 2000 AZN to buy cows so that she can increase the volume of milk products as she wants to increase her monthly income.  Gullu sells the milk products to the stores.

Gullu has been in the livestock business breeding cows for eight years now. She has learned this business from her aunt who also keeps livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor is an industrious father of four children. With his determination to send all his children to school, he is operating a farming business as a source of income. This business is risky and difficult but he persists in working for the betterment of his family’s living. He dreams of having a comfortable life with his loved ones and of helping to finish his children‘s education. 

For this reason, a 31 year-old is requesting a loan of PHP20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use to improve his business. With his strong determination and hard work, he hopes that there will be abundant crops so that his family will experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to develop his business.

loans.name: Amua Shg Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Amua SHG group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Amua SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and computers for cars.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 42-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 3 children, ages 10, 8 and 7.

Ma. Fe and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops to sell. Ma. Fe's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Ma. Fe, on the other hand, makes an extra income weaving mats to sell. She does her best to take care of her family and help provide for their needs.

Ma. Fe is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is from the village Oshora, in the southern part of the country. He is 51 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Zhuzhuna, three sons (26, 24 and 22 years old), a daughter-in-law and a one year-old grandson. All three sons of Rezo serve in the country’s army. Rezo is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own a dairy farm with 5 milk cows. He produces various dairy products (cheese, yogurt, cottage cheese) and sells them in Batumi (nearby town). His total average monthly profit from the farm is 300 Laris. 

Rezo requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. He will produce and sell more dairy products and increase the profit. The family will use increased income for further development of the family dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.ru:
Maleyka zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svyey semyoy. Maleyka 59 let.
 Ona uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya pereprodaji. Muj Maleyki boleyet i ne mojet rabotat poeotmu ona odna soderjit semyu. I yey nujno uvelichit mesachniye doxodi dlya lecheniya muja.
texts.en:
Maleyka is married and has four children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family. Maleyka is 59 years old.

She has been in the livestock business breeding cows for ten years now. Right now she needs 2000 AZN to buy a cows for resale. Maleyka's husband is ill and cannot work now so she is supporting the family. She also needs to increase her monthly income for her husband's treatment.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mutekesi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mutekesi Group in Western Kenya! Getrude is the facilitator of the Mutekesi group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Getrude takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Getrude had a very good maize yield, harvesting 22 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Getrude was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Getrude  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Getrude will educate her children and repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Mutekesi group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Getrude and her group with the field officer far right.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: За время отработки первого кредита по линии Кива, Нурбюбю показала себя ответственным и дисциплинированным человеком. Кредит позволил Нурбубу расширить ассортимент мебели и увеличить количество клиентов, повысив тем самым продажи. В целях дальнейшего расширения своей деятельности, Нурбюбю обратилась в компанию "Бай - Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом на покупку нескольких кубов леса, фанеры и станка. Это позволит Нурбюбю оптимизировать процесс заказов на мебель, так как сырье уже будет в цехе, что сэкономит время и ускорит производство необходимых образцов.
texts.en: During the process of the first loan through Kiva Nurbubu showed herself to be a responsible and disciplined woman. The loan allowed Nurbubu to expand the variety of furniture and increase the number of customers, thus increasing sales. In order to further expand the business Nurbubu has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som to buy a few cubes of wood, plywood and machinery. This will allow Nurbubu to optimize orders for furniture as the raw materials will already be in the shop which will save time and speed up production of the necessary samples.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture manufacturing.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is 43 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Ma. Lina's husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Lina sells fish for a living. She sells her husband's catch and also buys from other fishermen. Ma. Lina and her husband support each other to sustain their family.

Ma. Lina has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and more fish to sell. She hopes to be successful with her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more fish to sell

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is 42 years old and a mother of a son and a daughter. Both of her children are getting their education. In order to afford their education, Bilqees sews clothes for her community clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her brother, who also lives with her family and drives a tractor.   He provides loading services to his customers.  With the loan investment, he will buy new tires, because his tractor’s current tires have become rough and need replacement. By purchasing new tires, he will be able to run his tractor more smoothly and provide better quality services to his customers for better profits.
He has been operating his business for the past many years and Bilqees is confident that he will get more success in his business after the loan investment.
Note: "In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees."

loans.use: To buy tractor tires for loading business

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat is a rice cultivator as well as a hog raiser from Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She has a life partner in her husband who is a construction worker, and they are blessed with 3 school-aged kids. She really tried hard to look after her pigs and make her wooden piggery clean every day in order to keep her pigs healthy. This year Mrs. Tat wants to enlarge her piggery and buy additional piglets for raising. Therefore, she requires some funds from HKL and Kiva to invest in her pig-raising business. She hopes that she will be able to generate more income and better her living condition.

loans.use: to enlarge her wooden piggery and buy additional piglets for raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ornamental birds

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Marisa runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has 2 young children. Marisa's husband is engaged in fishing.

Marisa sells various items at her store such as packed noodles, soft drinks and canned goods. She also helps her husband sell fish to their community.

Marisa is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets and more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. Marisa hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgillo is 42 years old and blessed with six children. To provide for their needs, he is engaged in a farming business as a source of income. He suffers difficulty supporting his family because of their large household.  Nevertheless, he works hard to earn enough to pay the expenses for his family.  

Virgilio is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, used to develop his business. Through these inputs, hopefully he can yield bigger crops to save for his family. Though sometimes tiredness makes him weak to continue life, he still hopes to achieve a bright future. He knows that with the help of Almighty God, he can provide his families with the convenience of life.

loans.use: buy farming inputs

loans.name: Nurana

texts.ru: Ona zamujem. Nurana yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem. Nurana 22 qoda. Ona 2 qoda kak nachala zanimatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota i pereprodaji ix. Etom u biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoraya toje razvodila korov.
texts.en: Nurana is 22 years old, married and now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband. She is an internationally desplaced person (IDP). For the last two years she has been raising cattle. Currently Nurana needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy additional cattle for her her and future resale. Nurana has learned how to take care of livestock from her mother, who also raises cattle for a living.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mutekesi B Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Mutekesi B group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

John takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, John had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  John was only able to harvest 7 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Mutekesi B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chalkhaajav

texts.en:
Chalkhaajav has been working as a contract driver with a private company. He has been working as a driver for many years but had an accident with his wife in 2007.  Now his wife is on social welfare and always has to be nursed.  Chalkhaajav only recently got back to his job just a few months ago. He lives with his wife and his daughter in their small house which is built in the early 1970s.   

Lately his house has became very old and damaged in many parts, especially the floor, walls and the roof. Therefore he decided to make renovations to his house in order to live in comfortable living conditions with his family. According to his plan, he will add insulation to the walls and windows before this winter because there is always too much heat-loss by the uninsulated walls and windows. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchasing some necessary building materials to make renovations to his old house.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Jacqueline Tété

texts.fr: Jacqueline vit maritalement avec deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de divers et d'oeufs de poule. Elle exerce son commerce au marché de Vèdoko, l'un des marchés qui draîne beaucoup d'affluence. Pour se ravitailler, elle  se rend à AGRISSACH pour les oeufs Dans le but de répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle fait donc recours au financement de Finadev. Le bénéfice engendré lui permettra de  renforcer son fonds de commerce et de contribuer en partie aux charges du foyer.
texts.en: Jacqueline is married and has two children. Her main activity is to sell a variety of items including hens' eggs. She carries out her business at the Vèdoko market, one of the markets which attracts large crowds. She gets her supplies of eggs from Agrissach. With a view to responding to her customers' demand, she has turned to Finadev for a loan. The profits she makes will enable her to strengthen her business and to contribute towards the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 109 trays of eggs

loans.name: Sophon's Group

texts.en:
A 67-year-old married father with seven children, Sophon is a farmer who has been farming for 30 years as his main income source and supplementing his income as a village chief in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district. Two of his children are dependents; one is still in school and the last one works in a company. With his current income source, Sophon earns 2 US dollars per day. 

This is Sophon's first group loan with VisionFund. He leads a group of two members. Now requesting a loan, he will use it to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to make more rice so as to raise more income to build on some savings for renovating a house to live in and also keep his child in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Jargalsaikhan is 51 years old.  He lives currently with his wife and all of his children have moved out their parents' home. He has been working as a freight transportation driver since 2002 and already has his permanent clients in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. His monthly earnings usually do not meet his family necessities, therefore Jargalsaikhan decided run another business such as a meat selling at a market near his home.  Meat sales volume is always intensified during the winter time in Mongolia and he wants to make his first dealing this December.  He needs to build his business working capital to buy red meat. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase a large amount of meat for his new bulk meat business.

loans.use: purchase meat

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en:
Earnest, who is 36, has shown that devotion, steadfastness and sedulous work can bring many dividends in business. Plying his Irish potato farming trade for the last two years been a very worthwhile experience for him. Irish Potatoes are increasing becoming a staple food in most Ugandan households, and they sell very well in most food markets, not only in Kyenjojo but in the central region too, where Earnest intends to expand his market.

Earnest, who is single but plans to get married, has a weekly sales revenue of UGX 40,000, and also derives income from a barber shop. He says that the Kiva loan he is requesting will help finance the purchase of more germinating Irish potato seedlings to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more germinating Irish potato seedlings to grow.

loans.name: Dolgorkhand

texts.en:
Dolgorkhand, 38, runs a tailoring business.  She has been doing her business for 18 years non-stop. She lives with her husband and her 3 children in Kherlen, a western boundary town in Mongolia.  In addition to her tailoring shop, she sells natural salt with her friend Enkhtuya in the market. They have started their business together 2 years ago and now they already have their own permanent customers. 

Dolgorkhand and her friend bring the raw salt from other regions which are located far away, then process it.  This requires a truck for transportation and other expenses.   This month they plan to increase their working capital to extend sales volume. The loan she is taking will be used to buy salt in large amount to increase their sales volume.

loans.use: buy grocery salt

loans.name: Ya Umu

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Ya Umu. She is married to a businessman and has five children, two of whom are in university while the other three are in secondary school. In 1991, she went into business selling jeans, shirts, shoes, traveling bags, school bags and other items. She began her business because her father did not want her to complete school. Her step mother introduced her to business, and her husband gave her funds to start her company. She works seven days a week, 10 hours a day and earns Le 1,989,000 a month. She has successfully repaid three loans and is applying for a new one for Le 4,500,000 to buy jeans, shirts and shoes to sell to her customers. She will also use Le 140,000 to transport her goods. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 298,000.

In the future, Ya Umu plans to build a new house and expand her business by having opening shop. She also hopes to give all of her children a quality education. Her major challenge is the fluctuation in foreign currency, which sometimes affects what she has to pay for her goods. Her business is doing well because she has good relationships with her customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntuya, age 47, works as a cook in a hotel located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her job for over 10 years, and her customers are always satisfied. She lives with her husband and her nephew in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar. Her home is located 12 miles from her job. So she always has the problem of finding transportation to her job. Therefore, she decided to repair her old car, which has not functioned for two years. The car needs over 1,000,000 MNT in repairs to change the engine and other parts. She thinks that if she can easily get to her job, she can work normally, and it will influence her work efficiency. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the necessary spare parts to repair her broken car.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary spare parts to repair her broken car.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is requesting a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her decorative embroidery business. She is a very talented embroiderer and makes beautiful embroidered clothes for her neighboring clients. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery frames, beads and other embroidery material in bulk quantity to be able to make better-looking embroidered clothes, and to increase her profits.
Her husband is a factory worker and does his job from 9 AM to 5 PM.  Bushra has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son is also an embroidery expert while her youngest son works in a factory.  Bushra is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that she will get more success in her business by investing a loan in it.
Note: "In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Bushra."

loans.use: To buy embroidery frames, beads and other embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Dorjpagma

texts.en:
Mrs. Dorjpagma is widowed and a pensioner. She had worked as a merchant in a state organization for many years before she retired. Now she lives with one of her daughters and her nephew in her apartment which is located within the boundaries of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her apartment has become very old and uncomfortable to live in.  It was built about 40 years ago and all of its decoration and window insulation have disappeared now. Heat loss happens all the time in winter. Therefore, she decided to make the necessary adjustments to her apartment with hired workers.  With the loan, she will purchase some building materials to make the improvements to her apartment and to pay the salary for jobbers.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to make improvements to her apartment and to pay the salary for jobbers.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un médecin. Elle a 1 enfant.
Afi travaille comme vendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend du pure water en gros et des produits congelés pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Akodessewa et Hedzranawoe. Elle travaille seule. Au moment,elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Afi a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du pure water et des produits congelés. Elle veut agrandir son commerce.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait augmenter la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 29-year-old woman.  She is married to a physician and has one child.  Afi has been working as a salesperson since 2010.  She sells Pure Water wholesale.  She also sells and delivers frozen foods to all types of customers.  She buys her products in Akodessewa and Hedzranawoe. She works alone and does not currently encounter any difficulty.   Afi is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy Pure Water and frozen foods.  She would like to expand her business.  In the coming years, Afi would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods and Pure Water.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба сотрудничает с нашей организацией  с 2002 года. Первый кредит получила в 200 сомони на торговлю платками, косынками и носками. За несколько лет сотрудничества с нашей организацией несколько раз изменила  ассортимент  товара. Перепробовала торговлю на разные виды товаров и сейчас остановилась на хозяйственных товарах. Общий стаж  её предпринимательской деятельности составляет более 14 лет, в бизнесе помогает сын. Товар ей привозит знакомый с города Истаравшан. Муж работает декоратором в центре молодежи. Очень активная клиентка за период кредитования не имела ни одну просрочку, ее товар имеет большой спрос и не имеет сезонный характер. Получаемый кредит собирается использовать на расширения ассортимента товаров.
texts.en: Mahbuba has been working with our organization since 2002.  She obtained her first loan of 200 somoni for her business of selling shawls, scarves and socks.  She changed her goods assortment several times over the years of working with our organization.  Mahbuba tried to sell various types of merchandise and now stopped on household goods.  Her combined entrepreneurial experience amounts to more than 14 years.  Her son helps with this business.  Mahbuba's friend brings in merchandise from the city of Istaravshan.  Mahbuba's husband works as a decorator at a youth center.  She has been a very active client over the period of her credit history and did not have a single late payment.  Her merchandise is in high demand and is not seasonal.  Mahbuba plans to use this loan to expand her merchandise selection.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection of shawls, scarves and socks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and scarves

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Michael.  He is married and the father of a seven-year-old child. In 2009, when he dropped out of school, Michael established a business selling spare parts for bicycles. He is applying for a new loan, his fourth, for Le 5,000,000 to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers. He hopes this loan will allow him to increase his profits by Le 202,000. His goals for the future are to expand his business and educate his child through the university level. His business is popular because it has a good location. In the future, he plans to build his own shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Ermanboy

texts.ru: Эрмонбой вот уже более 20 лет  занимается бизнесом. Он занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Одновременно занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Ему выгодно содержать скот, потому что отходы от выращивания сельхозкультур идут на их корм. Его жена добрая и трудолюбивая. Она помогает мужу с удовольствием, и они стараются улучшить жизненные условия семьи. Эрмонбой хотел бы получить займ для покупки 5 голов крупно 15 голов мелкого скота, а на остальную сумму хочет посеять пшеницу и ячмень.
texts.en: Ermanboy has had a farm business for more than 20 years. He primarily raises sheep and cattle but also grows grains and produce for sale. Ermanboy uses leftover greens from his fields to feed his animals. His wife is kind and hardworking. She loves helping her husband at the farm and the two of them work hard to improve their family's living situation. Ermanboy wants to take out this loan to purchase five more cows and 15 more sheep for his herd, and will use the rest of the loan to plant wheat and oats.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Séraphine s'est spécialisée dans la vente de Bananes, oignons, choux, oeufs et tomates au marché Vèdoko. Elle fait ses empruntes dans un autre marché et chez les jardiniers de la place. Dans le but d'élagir son domaine d'activité, de satisfaire sa clientèle et de maximiser ses intérêts, elle sollicite et obtient un prêt à Finadev. Le revenu issu de ce prêt l'aidera à couvrir partiellement les charges de son foyer et à renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Séraphine is married and the mother of 2 children. She specializes in selling produce, including bananas, onions, cabbages, eggs and tomatoes, at the market of Vèdoko in Cotonou. She gets her supplies at another market, and from local gardeners.  

With the goal of expanding her business, satisfy her clientele and maximize her revenue, she sought and obtained a loan from FINADEV. The revenue from this loan will help her to cover part of the cost of her household, and to reinforce her stock.

loans.use: to buy 60 trays of eggs, 2 baskets of tomatoes, 1 basket of onions and some fruit.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил целеустремленный и ответственный человек. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Более 5 лет он занимается купле- продажей овец и выращиванием пшеницы и ячменя. Его жена помогает ему по ухаживанию и откорма скота, а также в  переработке земли и посева семян. Исроил хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони  для  покупки  5 голов овец и на  остальную сумму хочет посеять пшеницу и ячмень. На полученный доход хочет благоустроить свой дом.
texts.en: Isroil is a goal oriented and dependable man. He is married and has two children. For more then five years he has been growing wheat and oats and raising sheep. his wife helps him take care and feed the animals as well as work the land and plant seeds. Isroil wants to take out this loan of 3000 somoni to purchase five sheep and will use the rest of the money to plant more wheat and oats. He is hoping to use the profits from this loan to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: To buy sheep and seeds

loans.name: Kimnou's Group

texts.en:
Kimnou is 50 years old, widowed and has two children.  Her daughter is a tailor while her son is still in school.  She has been selling biscuits, eggs, detergent, candy etc. to feed her children.  With her current business, she earns less than 4 U.S. dollars per day. 

Kimnou leads a group of two members. She and her group member are the sixth cycled clients who have been with Vision Fund since 2005. After the loans, she has regular income and regularly support her son's study.  She hopes to increase her income and savings which she can set aside for the future.  The extra income will also help keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy inventory like biscuits, eggs, detergent for her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married to a trader, and has 3 children aged 16, 13 and 11 years.  He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him.

In 2001, Ibrahim established his tailoring items business - selling materials, thread, needles, designing threads.   He began his business after he completed his high school.   Unfortunately, his father, who was taking care of his schooling, died and his mother, who was sick died too, so there was nobody to take responsibility for him.   He decided to assist other people in their business until he raised enough capital to start his own business.  

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,900,000 every month from this business.  He is assisted by his wife and treats his customers fairly.  His customers are people around the city center and tailoring shops.   Mr. Ibrahim offers quality goods to satisfy their needs.   He uses public transport to buy  goods in Conakry and Freetown twice a month.  He would like a loan for Le 5,000,000.  Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase popline 1 bale @ Le2,500,000, lace cord 300 pieces @ Le6,000 and stickers 10 rolls @ Le70,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 885,000.

He uses his profit to invest in his business as he wants his children to have a very good education.   Instability of foreign exchange rate is his major challenge.   He anticipates using his profit to buy more goods and is planning to open another shop.  He knows he will be able to accomplish this goal.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Waterloo, a town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have request a loan to solve their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. The school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment on their behalf. 

Elizabeth is the leader of this group of teachers. The fifty-year old is a native of Makeni.  She is married to a pastor and the couple has three children. Elizabeth has requested this loan to buy some pieces of furniture and equipment for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Vuth, aged 31, is a farmer married with two children.  He has been farming for seven years in a rural area of the Moung Russey district where rice farming is common.   He supplements his income by buying and selling cows.

This is Vuth's first loan with VisionFund.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and will use a part of the loan to buy a cow for sale. This loan will enable him to make more rice and earn more income, which helps him to save and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and buy a cow

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Rugiatu. She is married to a businessman, and has 2 children, aged 20 and 6 years, who go to school. She has 1 additional dependent - a niece, who lives with her so she can attend a good school in town.

In 2000, Rugiatu established her retail business selling jeans, baby wrappers, blankets, blouse, nickers, and jewelry. When her mother died, Rugiatu was a child and her father could not take good care of her, so she had to live with his father's closest friend. She could not attend school because her caretaker did not think it appropriate. Several years later, the caretaker died and Rugiatu had to live with her older brother. They could barely afford to feed her, let alone pay for her schooling. So Rugiatu started trading in order to help with the household expenses. Ever since then, business is all she knows.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,798,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase ladies sandals - 3 cartons @ Le500,000, ladies jeans 60 pieces @ Le15,000, tights for ladies 120 pieces @ Le15,000, the balance Le300,000 as transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 270,000.

In the future, Rugiatu plans to build a house with a shop and is nervous about the future because she has a lot to do, to achieve her dreams. She wants her children to be educated. The loan will help as she will generate more income to run her business. Her major challenge is the rainy season. Though she sells in a secure stall that protects from the rain, she has fewer customers and therefore less profit during this season. Competition is high but she offers affordable prices, latest designs and quality goods. She serves about 15 customers per day, all ladies in the city and nearby villages . She uses public transport to buy her goods in Guinea-Conakry twice a month. She has been reinvesting her profits into her business. Rugiatu always pays on time and will continue to do so since the access to more loans is her only source of generating income. She is hard working and honest and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Musonyole Group

texts.en:
Nganasa is the facilitator of the Musonyole group. Nganasa and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Nganasa and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Nganasa takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Nganasa had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Nganasa was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Nganasa will educate his children and save for future use. In 2012, the members of Musonyole group will each plant maize on between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vision Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vision SHG Group in Western Kenya! Anjela is the facilitator of the Vision SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Anjela takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Anjela had a very good maize yield harvesting 30 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Anjela was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Anjela  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Anjela will educate her children and repay loans.

In 2012, the members of Vision SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Temirkhon

texts.ru: Темирхон имеет пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Для содержания большой семьи приходится много трудиться. Дети взрослые и помогают отцу по работе. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и откормом скота. На полученную прибыль хочет купить мебель для своего дома, чтобы создать удобства в семье.  Он имеет корм для скота от отходов выращенной сельхозкультуры. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он благодарен вам за поддержку и великодушие.
texts.en: Temirkhon has five children. His wife is a home maker. To support such a large family Temirkhon works very hard. His older children also help him with his business. Temirkhon has a farm where he grows produce and raises cattle. Temirkhon feeds his animals leftovers from his fields. He is planning to use the loan to purchase three more calves for his herd. He will use profits from this loan to purchase furniture for his home, to make it more comfortable for his family. Temirkhon thanks you for your support and generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Tojimurod

texts.ru: Тоджимурод умный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Он занимается откормом скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он содержит скот за счет кормов произведенных от выращивания сельхозпродуктов. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1500 Сомони для покупки 4 голов овец. На полученную прибыль хочет купить стройматериалы для постройки сарая. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Tojimurod is a smart and hardworking man. He is married and a responsible father of four children. Tojimurod raises livestock and farms. He feeds his animals with the crops that he grows on his own land. Tojimurod would like to take out a loan of 1500 somoni to purchase four more sheep. He is planning to use the profits from this loan to purchase building materials for a barn. Tojimurod hopes for your help and is grateful to everyone in advance.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her broiler chickens.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren is a 62-year-old mother, widowed and has two children.  One of her children is a barber and the other one is a factory worker.  Ren has been farming for 30 years and is her main source of income. With her current business, she earns around 10 U.S. dollars per day. 

This is Ren's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and will use some of the loan to rent a farm to grow more rice. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and extend her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Oisara

texts.ru: Ойсара занимается купле- продажей скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Её семья помогает ей в бизнесе. Они стараются улучшить жизненные условия и создать уют и удобства в своем доме. Ойсара хочет расширить свой бизнес и купить 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и посеять пшеницу и ячмень. С этой целью она просит о помощи, которая позволит ей продвигаться вперед.
texts.en: Oisara raises cattle for meat and also farms. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Her family helps her with her work. Oisara's family is working hard to improve their living conditions and to create a cozy and comfortable home. Oisara wants to expand her herd and plans to purchase three more calves as well as plant more wheat and oats. For this reason she has turned to KIVA for help as this will helps her to move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 54 year-old Memunatu. She is married to a trader, and has 6 children aged 25, 20, 19, 17, 15 and10 years. Three are all school going children. In 1997, Memunatu established her groundnut and onions business. She began her business because she was living with her uncle, who intended to see her through school, but his wife refused to allow that and suggested instead that Mumunatu join the business. Memunatu's parents were poor and could not help her, so they had no alternative but to agree with the aunt since Memunatu was living with the aunt and uncle. Memunatu was introduced to the business at a young age and now she can boast of being a very good business woman.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,564,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Memunatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy groundnuts - 8 bags @ Le450,000 and onions 5 bags @ Le80,000. She hopes that this loan will help increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 385,000.

In the future, Memunatu plans to build a house. She wants to educate her children because she herself was deprived from it. A part of the profit will be reinvested in her business and the rest will be saved for her children's education. She is hard working and honest, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and onions for her business.

loans.name: Bobo

texts.ru: Бобо занимается скотоводством и одновременно выращивает сельхозпродукты. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, иногда помогает мужу. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и хочет купить скот потому что  хочет содержать их на отходы выращенных сельхозпродуктов . С этой целью Бобо запрашивает займ и просит вас о финансовой помощи. Он надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bobo raises cattle and grows crops. He is married and is raising three children. His wife is a home maker and sometimes helps her husband with the farm. Bobo wants to expand his business and buy more animals which he plans to feed with leftovers from his crop harvest. For this reason Bobo is requesting this loan and asking you for financial assistance. He hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ruxsara

texts.ru: Ruxsara 35 let. Ona zamujuem i imeyet 3 detey. Ruxsara yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Ona uje 4 goda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Ruxsara nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji. Ona delayet sir i kefir iz moloka i prodayet ix u sebya doma. Ona imeyet mnogo kliyentov takje sredi sosedey.
texts.en: Ruxsara is 35 years old, married and has three children. She is an internally displaced person from Fuzuli city and currently lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family. For more then four years she has been raising cattle for milk production. Ruxsara needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to purchase another milk cow and increase the volume of dairy products she can offer for sale. Ruxsara uses the milk from the cows to make kefir and sells it from her home. Her business has a number of regular clients, especially among her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Lukose Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lukose Group in Western Kenya! Consolata is the facilitator of the Lukose group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Consolata takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Consolata had a good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Consolata was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Consolata  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Consolata will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Lukose group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en:
Thoeun is 54 years old, married with five children, four of whom are dependents who work in Thailand.  She runs a small grocery store selling biscuits, fruit, eggs etc to feed her family and supplements her income by catching fish for sale. With her current business, she earns less than 2 U.S. dollars per day and can save less than 1 U.S. dollar per day. 

Thoeun leads a group of two members who has been with VisionFund since 2010. This is her group's second loan with VisionFund and she successfully repaid the first loan. The loan from VisionFund helped her to have a regular income.  She is now requesting a loan to buy piglets as another income source for her family. This loan will enable her to raise pigs to generate additional income, and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy and raise piglets

loans.name: Chobeli Farmers Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Chobeli Farmers group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Violet takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had a good maize yield harvesting 5 bags on 1/4 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Violet was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/4 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Violet will educate her children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Chobeli Farmers group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shargiya

texts.ru: Shargiya 46 let. Ona uje 9 let zanimayetsya skotovodstavom i razvodit korov. Shargiya xochet kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota a takje molochnogo produkta i poetomu ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Shargiya zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. U nix bolshaya semya i im nado uvelichit mesachniye doxodi. Ona delayet razniye molochniye kachestvenniye produkti i prodayot ix v magazini.
texts.en: Shargiya is 46 years old. She has been running a livestock business by breeding cows for nine years. Shargiya wants to buy cows to increase the headcount of cattle and also the amount of milk products and this is why she needs 2000 AZN. She is an internally displaced person relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now living in the Fuzuli region together with her friendly family. Shargiya is married and has four children. They have a big family and they need to increase their monthly income. She makes different types of quality milk products and sells them to the stores.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mulwanda Shg Group

texts.en:
Michael is the facilitator of the Mulwanda SHG group. Michael and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Michael takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Michael had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Michael was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Michael and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Michael will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mulwanda SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Michael is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tushauriane Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tushauriane Group in Western Kenya! Agnes is the facilitator of the Tushauriane group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Agnes takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Agnes will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tushauriane group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

texts.en:

This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers want a loan of 11,000,000.00 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is a native of Mabonto, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-five year old, married and has six children who attend primary and secondary schools. Mohamed has requested this loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from one of the institutions in Waterloo, a town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. School staff and other salaried workers do come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni to seek loans. With the help of these loans, they are able to solve problems that their salaries alone cannot solve. Then at the end of each month their bursar or finance officer repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Hassan is the leader of this group of teachers. The twenty-three year old is a native of Mile Ninety village. He is married and has three children. Hassan has requested this loan in order to buy a television set for his household.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his household.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the business of rental houses for the last five years and earns a monthly profit of KES.10,000. He is 34 years old married to Truphena and they have four school going children.

He has applied for his first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to buy materials for constructing more rental houses.

He plans to save the anticipated profits and buy another plot. Daniel hopes to grow his business and become the most known landlord in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for constructing more rental houses.

loans.name: Grégoire Birame

texts.fr:
Monsieur Grégoire Birame est un jeune frigoriste âgé de 35 ans et père de deux enfants. Son activité consiste à vendre des pièces détachées. Il est aussi réparateur de frigo .Métier qu’il exerce depuis  plus de 6 ans.
Avec le crédit il envisage d’acheter  des moteurs de réfrigérateurs et du gaz pour  le revendre.
Avec les revenus de son activité Grégoire arrive à satisfaire  les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Grégoire Birame is 35 years old and the father of 2 children. He has been a refrigeration engineer for over 6 years and sells spare parts as well as repairing fridges.

Grégoire will use this loan to buy refrigerator motors and gas for resale. His earnings allow him to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator motors and gas for resale.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда женщина 47 лет, торгующая на рынке нижним женским бельём и женскими гамажами и колготками. У неё трое взрослых уже семейных детей, одна дочь и два сына. Мавчуда давно в разводе с мужем. Её старший сын работает в Р.Ф строителем и присылает маме каждый месяц деньги на семейные расходы. Мавчуда  сама смогла выдать дочь замуж с помощью сына, т.к её товарооборот не большой, а следовательно и прибыль тоже, и хватает лишь на ежедневные расходы домашнего обихода. Каждый свой кредит она использует на завоз товара, поэтому на следующий кредит она хочет привезти зимние гамажи и колготки для женщин. Она благодарна всем инвесторам и «Арванд» за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Mavchuda is a 47 year-old woman, who sells women's undergarments and women's leggings and stockings.  She has three adult children - one daughter and two sons, all of whom already have their own families.  Mavchuda has been divorced from her husband for a long time.  Her oldest son works in the Russian Federation as a construction worker and sends money to his mother every month to cover family expenses.  Mavchuda was able to marry off her daughter with the help of her son because her goods turnover is not high and neither is the profit, which is only enough to cover household expenses.  Mavchuda uses each one of her loans to bring in merchandise and wants to use this loan to bring in winter leggings and stockings for women.  She is grateful to all investors and "Arvand" for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Seygah

texts.ru:
Seygah yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Seygah 50 let. 
Ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. Uje 7 let Seygah zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en:
Seygah is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) resettled from the city of Fuzuli and now living in the Fuzuli region with her husband and children.  She is married, has three children, and is 50 years old.

She needs 2000 AZN to buy some cows to increase the number of cattle she has for sale.  Seygah has already been raising and breeding cattle for seven years.  She learned this business from her mother.

loans.use: to buy some cows.

He has applied for his first loan of KES.30, 000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more meat for sale.

He plans to save the anticipated profits and open another outlet. Daniel hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of more cattle. He also intends to expand his butcher shop.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est un jeune tailleur  âgé de 33 ans, marié et père  d’un enfant. Son activité consiste à confectionner des ensembles pour hommes et dames. Son atelier se situe au cœur du marché local. 
Avec le prêt il  envisage d’acheter une variété de tissus, les confectionner  pour les revendre.
Ibrahima arrive à gérer sa petite famille et à subvenir à leur besoin au quotidien.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is 33 years old, married and the father of one child. He is a tailor and makes outfits for men and women. His workshop is located in the centre of the local market.

Ibrahima will use this loan to buy a variety of fabrics with which to make outfits for resale. His income allows him to take care of his family and their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric to create outfits to sell

loans.name: Nurses Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to introduce to you this group of nurses from one of the hospitals in Waterloo. Waterloo is a town very close to Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with us to start a branch. This staff, like other salaried workers, comes to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan. They use these loans to fix problems that their salaries cannot fix. At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their finance officer is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayment on their behalf. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. The thirty-five year old was born in Makeni. She is married and has one child. Kadiatu has been a state registered nurse for few years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy some drugs and drips for sale in the hospital.

loans.use: to buy some drugs and drips for sale in their hospital.

Bamanasi takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. loans.name: Anonymous Group
