Ella esta requiriendo un segundo crédito para invertir en ropa ya que se aproxima las fiestas de Diciembre donde las venta se elevan bastante además de ofrecer variedad de productos en pulpería comestibles para preparar la cena navideña, vender piñatas para los niños pues quiere introducir poco a poco artículos que la competencia no ofrece. Pues tiene bien firmes sus metas como son prosperara y crecer su negocio, reparar su casa y cambiar el nivel de vida a su familia para vivir de manera digna y honrada.
texts.en:
Doña Luz, from León, is a retailer who is happy, dynamic, and is preparing herself for the Christmas season.  We meet Luz getting her convenience store ready for the day's sales.

The changes that she has experienced through her Kiva loan have been very positive for her life and her business.  She has been able to accomplish one of her objectives by stocking up her convenience store and investing in the purchase of new clothing for resale.  Her sales have improved, as she was able to invest in a variety of products which were much needed by her influx of customers.  Her sales have become more steady and her income has improved, even in spite of the increase in prices which she is constantly facing.  However, even as the business has been going well, she can see other good changes.

She is requesting a second loan to invest in clothing, as the December holidays are approaching when her sales increase significantly.  She also wants to offer a variety of products for sale in her convenience store: foods to prepare for Christmas dinner, piñatas for the children.  Little by little, she wants to be able to introduce items that her competition don't sell.

She is holding firm to her goals such as prospering and growing her business, fixing up her home, and changing her family's standard of living so that they can live in a dignified and honorable way.

loans.use: to invest in clothing for sale as the December holidays are approaching, and buy products for her convenience store such as foods to prepare for Christmas dinner and piñatas for the children.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Nelly con su credikiva anterior, compró mercancía en mayor cantidad como ropa, adornos y hasta  planes de recarga para ampliar su oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciones. En la actualidad está planeando invertirle a su negocio en la época navideña y de fin de año, pues conoce que en esta época usualmente es muy efectiva la inversión. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa infantil y femenina, adornos navideños y nuevos planes de minutos, para que sus clientes tengan la oportunidad de acercarse en masa a saludar a sus familiares y desearle el  “feliz y próspero año 2012” a través de los servicios de telecomunicaciones que Nelly ofrece. Ella pide a los financiadores de Kiva  "que sigan ayudando para seguir avanzando."
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Nelly purchased a greater quantity of merchandise such as clothing, ornaments, and even phone minute reloading plans to expand her telecommunications services offerings. Currently, she is planning to invest it in her business at Christmastime and New Year's, since she knows that at this time investment is usually very effective. This is why she is taking out a new Kiva loan, with which she will purchase children's and women's clothing, Christmas ornaments, and new minutes plans, so that her customers will have the opportunity to be closer to their families and will be able to wish them a "happy and prosperous 2012" through the telecommunications services Nelly offers. She asks that Kiva lenders "continue helping to continue advancing".

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes, Christmas ornaments, and new phone minutes plans.

loans.name: Serapia Rosalia

texts.es: Serapia,es viuda tiene 55 años de edad tiene 6 hijos pero con ella solo tiene a la hija de 16 años de edad ya que los demas son casados ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y venta de ponchos, ropa, zapatos ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años cuando sus hijos iban a la escuela ya que sus esposo se dedicaba a trabajar en el campo y lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba para sostener a su familia,con el paso del tiempo ella ha incrementado sus ventas ella esta solicitando este credito para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir mas su tienda,espera que kiva le pueda ayudar.
texts.en: Serapia is a 55 year old widow, has six children but only her 16 year old daughter lives with her as her other children are married, she sells groceries and ponchos, clothes and shoes, she started this business 25 years ago when her children were going to school because her husband worked farming and what he earned was not sufficient to support the family, as time went by she increased sales and requests a loa to buy more merchandise and stock her store, she hopes that Kiva can help.

loans.use: to buy groceries, ponchos, jackets and shoes.

loans.name: Yamil Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Yamil tiene 42 años de edad, vive en barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de San marcos de Colon, junto con el viven sus hijos y su esposa, que le ayuda en su trabajo,  Yamil es bien honrado, responsable y muy dedicado a su actividad, que es la fabricacion de botas de cuero,  actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, este tipo de calzado es muy bien vendido en esta zona, es una zona de ganado y caballos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para fabricar las botas, desea tener mayores ventas y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar, desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yamil is 42 years old. He lives in the San Francisco neighborhood of San Marcos de Colon with his children and his wife, who helps him with his work. Yamil is very honest and responsible, and he is very dedicated to his work, which is making leather boots. He has done this for four years. This type of footwear sells very well in this region, since it is a region of cattle and horses. 

He will use the loan to purchase materials to make the boots. He wants to have more sales in order to have more earnings, which he needs to cover the costs of his household. He wants to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase leather, soles for boots, thread, hemp, and glue

loans.name: Petrona Florinda

texts.es: Petrona,ella tiene 52 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella nos cuenta que desde que inicio su negocio,a tenido mucha dificultad porque no a tenido suficiente capital para surtir su negocio,es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles,como arroz frijol,fideos,sopas,aceite,maiz,etc.ya que nos cuenta que es una bonita oportunidad de aumentar sus ganacias y su mercaderia.
texts.en: Petrona is 52, she sells basic need groceries, she mentions that since she began her business it has been really difficult because she has never had enough capital to stock the business, this is why she requests a loan to buy groceries as this would be a good opportunity to increase her merchandise and income. She will purchase rice, beans, pasta, soup, oil, corn and other items, since this is a good opportunity to increase her earnings and stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, pasta, soup, oil, corn and other items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Enma Elvia

texts.es:
Enma es una mujer de 56 años que vive junto a su hija de 18 años en Santo Domingo  "donde la patria se encuentra". Esta es una ciudad dinámica y acogedora perteneciente a la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas". En esta tierra habitan ciudadanos de todos los rincones del Ecuador, lo que la hace diversa y emprendedora y esa es precisamente su identidad. Se encuentra en una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, teniendo una temperatura promedio de 22,9°C. Por su ubicación geográfica, tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa. La actividad más importante es la ganadera, pues es aquí es en donde se desarrolla el mayor mercado ganadero del Ecuador. Por encontrarse en una zona tropical y estar limitado por una rama de la cordillera de Los Andes existe una alta biodiversidad y pisos ecológicos que crean una variedad infinita de ecosistemas.

Enma se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza para poder aportar a la economía de su hogar, no vive con su esposo ya que él migró a España para realizar trabajos de albañilería. Enma quiere invertir en mercadería ya que esta época navideña las ventas son muy altas porque las personas compran estos artículos para armar canastillas de navidad y regalarlas.  Por esta razón ella acudió a Fundación Alternativa en busca de un crédito que le permita invertir y mejorar sus ingresos; nos comenta que le gusta las capacitaciones que esta institución da a sus clientes y el trato de su oficial de crédito.

Ella espera poder mejorar su calidad de vida con esta inversión y así poder dar una mejor vida y educación a su hija
texts.en:
Enma is a 56-year-old woman who lives with her 18-year-old daughter in Santo Domingo "where the homeland is found". This is a dynamic and friendly city belonging to the "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" province. Citizens from all corners of Ecuador live in this area, making it diverse and entrepreneurial, and this is precisely its identity. It is located in a rainy, subtropical climate zone, with an average temperature of 22.9°C. Due to its geographical location, it is very active commercially, since it has become an inland port of trade between mountain and coast. The most important activity is cattle ranching, since the largest cattle market in Ecuador is here. Since it is located in a tropical area and limited by a branch of the Andes mountain range, there is a high degree of biodiversity and ecological zones that create an infinite variety of ecosystems.

Enma sells cleaning products in order to be able to contribute to the household finances. She does not live with her husband, since he immigrated to Spain to do bricklaying work. Enma wants to invest in merchandise, since sales are very high this Christmas season because people buy these items to fill Christmas baskets and give them as gifts. For this reason she came to Fundación Alternativa in search of a loan that would allow her to invest and improve her earnings; she tells us that she likes the training that this institution gives its clients and the treatment from her loan officer.

She hopes to be able to improve her quality of life with this investment and in this way be able to give her daughter a better life and education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria a sus 53 años de edad es madre de tres hijos, se dedica desde hace 12 años a la reparación y arreglo de prendas de vestir desde su casa con la ayuda de una maquina de coser familiar que adquirió. Adicional a esta labor realiza lencería, acolchados para camas y bolsos en índigo y cuero sobre pedido. La señora Gloria requiere de la compra de una máquina plana que le permita confeccionar prendas de mayor tamaño. Con lo anterior, la señora Gloria podrá mejorar su eficiencia y producción, y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. El sueño de la señora Gloria es poder configurar su propio taller de confección y en este poder generar empleos directos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sra. Gloria, 53, has three children.  She has operated a tailoring business for 12 years, fitting and mending clothing pieces on an ordinary sewing machine that she bought and installed at home.  She also makes products to order: lingerie, comforters and leather bags, for example.  Sra. Gloria wants to buy an industrial-sized sewing machine so that she can fill orders for larger garments.  Replacing the old machine with the new one will allow her to improve her output and operate more efficiently.  Her goal is to open a workshop, something that would both generate employment for others and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Angelica Mercedes

texts.es: Angélica Mercedes tiene 27 años de edad, tiene una actividad económica que es una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su lugar de domicilio, ella con mucho esfuerzo y con capital propio inicio su negocio del apoyo de su familia. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para  aumentar su inventario del negocio, y realizar las compras de granos básicos, aceite, huevos, shampoo, jabón, entre otros productos y dar una excelente atención a sus clientes ofreciéndole variedad en productos del hogar.
texts.en: Angélica Mercedes, 27, owns a general store that she operates from her house.  Opening the store required a lot of effort, but she was able to do it using her own savings and help from her family.  She is applying for a loan to stock her business.  She will buy cooking oil, eggs, shampoo, soap and other everyday merchandise that she will then resell.  The investment will allow her to meet demand for the products that her customers most want.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells fish for a living. She also makes "tinabal" (salted fish, which is packed in salt in a plastic container for days to age) to sell. Virginia's husband is a fisherman and she also helps in selling his catch at the market.

Virginia has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. Virginia hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (uno de 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.		

Henry es un hombre soltero de 27 años que se dedica a trabajar para poder ganar dinero y ayudar a su familia. Él es un hombre trabajador, luchador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su trabajo básicamente consiste en transportar a personas desde la ciudad de Ica hasta Santiago de Creocorgos.						
Henry empezó su negocio en el año 2009 en el área de transporte. Trabaja diariamente y recibe un promedio de S/. 296 de ganancia en una semana. Este es el primer préstamo de Henry y esta entusiasmado por la ayuda que se le brindará. Con el préstamo de S/.2, 500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Henry puede comprar una bomba de inyección para su camioneta y también le servirá para poder pagar los trámites que son necesarios para sus familiares. Su crédito permite a Henry pensar en el futuro y sueña con poder tener una empresa de transporte a la cual se dedicaría sólo a administrar, también desea tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Henry lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country. It is acclaimed by the Peruvians as “La Tierra del Sol” [The Land of the Sun]. It is known in Perú for frequent earthquakes (8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), grape, asparagus and olive production and above all perhaps, as the source of the traditional Peruvian drink, Pisco. It is in this hot, dry climate that the client’s home and business are located.

Henry is a 27 year old single man who works to earn money and help his family. He is a hardworking, determined man with a great desire to get ahead. His work basically consists of providing transport for people from the city of Ica to Santiago de Creocorgos.

Henry started his business in 2009 in the transport industry. He works every day and earns an average of S/.296 per week. This is Henry’s first loan and he is excited by the support that is being provided to him. With the loan of S/.2,500 that he will receive thanks to KIVA, Henry can buy an injection pump for his vehicle and it will also allow him to pay for his family’s necessities. Henry’s loan will allow him to think about the future. He dreams of having a transport business which he would solely run. He also wants to have his own family.

loans.use: to buy an injection pump for his vehicle.

loans.name: Bienvenida De Jesus

texts.es:
La joven Bienvenida de Jesus tiene 26 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar, sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio, tambien desea comprar ropa, ya que la epoca de navidad esta por llegar y quiere aprovechar a vender ropa que es uno de los productos que mas se venden en la navidad.
Junto con ella vive su esposo y su hija, por quien dia a dia trabaja muy fuerte para sacarla adelante.
texts.en: Bienvenida de Jesus, 26, is a young woman, entrepreunerial and determined to make her own way in the world.  She owns a retail business selling everyday products.  She operates the business from a space in her house.  Her customers are her friends and neighbors.  She will use this loan to stock her business.  She also wants to buy seasonal clothing because Christmas is coming and clothing is among the merchandise most in demand this time of year.  Beinvenida de Jesus lives with her husband and daughter and she's working night and day to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Maria Barbara

texts.es: Con su nuevo credikiva, Maria comprará refrescos y bebidas, además invertirá en adecuaciones locativas, para deleitarse brindando a sus clientes todo lo que les gusta y en un ambiente confortable. Ella envia el siguiente saludo a sus financiadores: " Un saludo especial y muchas gracias a todos las personas que a través de su apoyo económico hacen posible la financiación de nuestros negocios". Con su anterior credikiva preparó nuevos alimentos y compró refrescos y bebidas que vendiendolas, le ayudaron a incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: With her new Kiva loan, Maria will buy soda and other drinks.  She will also invest in making structural changes to her business so that she can provide her customers with everything they enjoy in a comfortable environment.  Maria sends the following greeting to her lenders: "A special greeting and many thanks to all the people who, through their financial support, are helping to finance our businesses".  Maria used her previous Kiva loan to prepare new food.  She also bought soda and other drinks to sell.  This helped her to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy soda and other drinks, and to invest in making structural changes to her business

loans.name: Sonia Maricela

texts.es:
La joven Sonia Maricela tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Providencia de la ciudad de Choluteca, ahi vive con su esposo y sus hijos,  Sonia  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada clasificada, tiene muchos clientes ya que la ropa que vende es de buena calidad y la vende a un precio accesible, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa.
Sonia dia a dia trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Maricela is a young woman of 25 who lives in La Providencia neighborhood, in the city of Choluteca.  She lives there with her husband and children.  Sonia sells pre-sorted used clothing.  She has many customers as the clothes she sells are good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  She will use her loan to buy a bundle of clothes.

Sonia works very hard every day to grow her business so that she can offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es: El señor Jaime Arturo es un emprendedor quien tiene su propio negocio en el cual vende snacks, tintos y minutos a celular. El horario de trabajo del señor Jaime Arturo es de 7:30 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. de lunes a sábado.  Aunque el señor Jaime Arturo tiene dificultades para caminar debidas a una enfermedad que le dio cuando niño, el señor Jaime Arturo trabaja arduamente para generar sus propios ingresos. El señor Jaime Arturo requiere de la compra de surtido tal como snacks, dulces y galletas, que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y así sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño del señor Jaime Arturo es poder organizar su vivienda propia.
texts.en: Jaime Arturo is an entrepreneur who has his own business where he sells snacks, coffee, and cell phone minutes. Jaime's work schedule runs from 7:30am to 7:00pm, Monday through Saturday. Although Jaime Arturo has difficulty walking due to an illness he had when he was a child, he works very hard to earn his own income. Jaime Arturo needs to purchase supplies such as snacks, sweets, and cookies that will allow him to increase his sales and thus his income, and improve his quality of life. Jaime Arturo's dream is to be able to have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as snacks, sweets, and cookies

loans.name: Duo Dulces Sueños Group

texts.es: Duo Dulces Sueños,este duo esta integrado por dos personas que se dedican al comercio y luchan dia a dia para salir adelante,Maria Clemencia,ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 14 años.en la localidad donde ella vive,ella nos cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para elavora tamales,esta muy contenta porque cree que con este credito podra aumentar mas la venta de tamales y asi poder ayudar a su familia.al igual que la siquiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Dulces Sueños is composed of two people engaged in business and who struggle every day to get ahead. 

Maria Clemencia has been selling tamales for a living for the past 14 years in the town where she lives. She tells us that she's applying for this loan so she can buy the ingredients to make tamales. She is very happy because she believes that, with this loan, she will be able to increase her tamale sales and thus help her family.  

Like Maria, the other member is applying for this loan to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa tiene 49 años de edad, vive en barrio la providencia de la ciudad de choluteca y se dedica a la venta de comida como ser desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, tambien vende ropa usada, su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico en donde transitan muchas personas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de comidas y ropa usada, en esta epoca de navidad se vende bastante la ropa y desea tener variedad para tener mayores ganancias.
Junto a ella vive su esposo y su hijo, por quien trabaja muy fuerte para sacarlo a delante, dandole una buena educacion y una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old.  She lives in La Providencia neighborhood, in the city of Choluteca, and her business is selling food (breakfasts, lunches and sweet treats).  She also sells used clothing.  Felipa's business is in a strategic location and there are a lot of passersby.

Felipa will use her loan to buy food and used clothing.  During the Christmas season, Felipa sells quite a lot of clothes and she would like to have a good variety available so that she can make more profits.

Felipa lives together with her husband and her son.  She works very hard in order to get her son ahead in life and provide him with a good education and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, chicken, oil, beans, eggs, tortillas, seasonings and used clothing

loans.name: Vanessa Esther

texts.es:
VANESSA ESTHER
Doña Vanessa, es casada tiene 3 hijos los tres están estudiando en el municipio de San Raymundo, ella es dueña de una venta de Ropa Americana y venta de ropa nueva en su casa, desde hace 10 años, nos cuenta que está necesitando este crédito porque  quiere invertir un poco más en la venta de ropa americana ya que en el municipio donde ella vive la mayoría de gente viste con esa ropa entonces es muy solicitada porque la ropa que ella vende es de buena calidad, por lo tanto es de mayor precio al comprarla, además es una muy buena época para invertir ya que se aproxima la época navideña, y entonces las personas compran ropa para sus hijos y familia, por lo tanto hay más demanda del negocio por eso necesita comprar en esta fecha porque después se escasea la mercadería  o se eleva el precio del producto, confía en que fape pueda brindarle a poyo al agrandar su negocio, y obtener un poco mas de ganancias y seguir apoyando a sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en: Doña Vanessa is married and has 3 children all of whom are studying in San Raymundo. For the last 10 years she has been the owner of a used and new clothes store which is located in her house. She tells us that she needs this loan because she wants to invest a little more in used clothes sales as in the area where she lives the majority of people wear this kind of clothing so her store is well frequented as the clothes she sells are of good quality and so cost more to buy. In addition it is a good time of the year to invest as the Christmas season is approaching and people buy clothes for their children and families so there is more demand which is why she needs to buy now as later merchandise will be scarce or cost more. She hopes that Fape will be able to support her in growing her business and obtaining a little more profit to continue helping her children who are studying.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is six. 

Amelita is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She mainly grows rice crops to sell. Amelita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. Amelita hopes this loan will help her have an abundant harvest. Amelita also hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ilda Maria

texts.es: La señora Ilda a sus 48 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa interior para venderla posteriormente a crédito a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. La señora Ilda lleva 27 años desempeñando este oficio. Con motivo de la temporada de navidad, la señora Ilda requiere comprar surtido de ropa interior con el fin de tener mercancía disponible para suplir la demanda de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Ilda podrá aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de un hermano que vive con ella y esta en situación de discapacidad mental. El sueño de la señora Ilda es tener una casa propia para su hermano y ella.
texts.en: Ilda is 48 years old. She buys underwear, which she then sells to her neighbors, family, and friends on credit. Ilda has been doing this for 27 years. Due to the Christmas season, Ilda needs to purchase supplies of underwear with the goal of having merchandise available to meet the end-of-year demand. With these supplies, Ilda will be able to increase her sales, and in this way improve her quality of life and that of a brother who lives with her and is mentally incapacitated. Ilda's dream is to have her own house for herself and her brother.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lesbia Baleska

texts.es:
La sra. Lesbia tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de los Colorados, ahi vive con sus hijos y su esposo, Lesbia es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 3 años, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
Lesbia trabaja duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, desea darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sra. Lesbia, 29, lives in the rural town of Colorados with her husband and children.  Lesbia is a hard-working woman.  She owns a general store where she sells the merchandise that is most in demand here.  She operates the store from a space in her house and sells everyday products.  She has owned the business for 3 years.  She will use this loan to buy the merchandise she needs to stock her business.  Lesbia works hard to support her children because she wants them to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Solidario Libano Group

texts.es:
DUO LIBANO
Este grupo está formado por doña María Juliana, casada, de 42 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración de comales y a comprar y vender también desde hace 6 años, también esta doña Rosa Irma, de 44 años, ella es soltera, se dedica a la venta de huevo, desde hace 5 años, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder comprar más huevos porque la clientela ha aumentado, y ahora solicitan mas producto y ella no tiene para poder invertir, también está la líder de este grupo que es doña Rosa, de 56 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 6 hijos, y nos cuenta que desde hace 13 años, es dueña de una pequeña tienda ubicada en el caserío los Estrada en la aldea donde vive, ella necesita este crédito porque se avecina la época navideña, y ella quiere vender productos de la época, frutas  golosinas, también aguas, y galletas, por eso quiere que se le sigua apoyando con este nuevo crédito  y así seguir manteniendo su clientela que hasta ahora siguen comprando en su tienda.
texts.en:
DUO LIBANO
This group is formed by Maria Juliana, married, 42 years old, who for the past 6 years has made a living making comales [a metal cooking surface] and to buying and selling. 

There is also Rosa Irma, 44 years old, single, who for the past 5 years has made a living selling eggs. She tells us that she is requesting this loan to be able to buy more eggs because her clientele has grown and they now ask for more product and she doesn't have enough money to invest in it. 

There is also the leader of this group, Rosa, 56 years old, married with 6 children. She tells us that for 13 years she has been the owner of a small store located in the Estrada neighborhood of the town where she lives. She needs this loan because the Christmas season is coming, and she wants to sell seasonal products - fruit candy, drinks, and cookies.  This is why she wants the support of this new loan and therefore be able to continue to maintain her clientele who continue to buy in her store.

loans.use: to buy food products for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de los Nuevos Colorados, ahi vive con su hija quien le ayuda en su negocio, que es la produccion y venta de tortillas,  actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, Juana es una mujer que trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio y tener buenas ganancias, todo esto para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
texts.en: Sra. Juana, 56, lives with her daughter in the rural town of Nuevos Colorados.  Her daughter helps her with the business making and selling tortilas.  She has made her living from the business for 8 years.  Juana is working hard to expand her business and increase her earnings.  She is fighting for a better quality of life and this loan will allow her to buy the supplies she needs to make the tortillas she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Aníbal a sus 59 años de edad es padre de cinco hijos, se dedica desde hace 22 años a la venta de productos comestibles como dulces y snacks de manera ambulante, es decir, sin un puesto fijo en las calles, su sitio de trabajo es en el parque principal del municipio de bello ubicado al norte de Antioquia, el cual recorre caminando con el carro adecuado con sus productos. El señor Aníbal desea comprar surtido para su negocio y así poder aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño del señor Aníbal es poder ayudarles a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en: Sr. Anibal, 59, has five children.  He has worked as a street vendor for 22 years, selling sweets and snacks to passers-by.  He normally targets customers in the main city park in Bello, a town in northern Antioquia.  He owns a cart, loaded with the merchandise he sells, and moves from place to place as he needs to.  Sr. Anibal wants to stock his business so that he can increase his sales and improve his quality of life.  His goal is to help his children finish their studies and find good-paying jobs.

loans.use: compra de surtido

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es: La Sra. Dina  es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Somos Impacto 2006” grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Dina trabaja desde hace  30 años en la venta de anticuchos, pancita y menú, este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio,  ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a sus 2  hijos  y es así que empezó vendiendo en la puerta de su casa anticuchos con el tiempo se hizo más conocida y  empezó a tener mayor cantidad de clientes con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y es así que obtuvo mayores ingresos y empezó a construir su casa, hoy en día alquila su casa y sigue vendiendo anticuchos y menú,  Dina  nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran sus hijos y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, su hijos ya son adultos  y ambos han puesto una empresa de confección de ropa, y sobre todo ella cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar  insumos, carnes y condimentos  , Sabemos que Dina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Dina has been selling kebobs, “pancita” (grilled pig stomach) and daily meals for 30 years.   This business emerged as a result of her divorce.  She had to work to support her two children.  That is how she started selling kebabs at the doorway of her house.  In time she became more well-known, and she started to have more customers. 

In time her business was growing, she got greater income, and she started building her house.  Now she rents her house and continues selling kebobs and meals.  Dina tells us that everything she obtained was with much work and perseverance.  Her children were her motivation, and her desire to improve was bigger than her problems.  

Thanks to her effort and dedication she managed to improve her income.  Her children are now adults, and both of them have established a business making clothes.  Above all, she tells us that she has a better quality of life.

In order to continue growing she has requested a new loan to buy supplies, meat, and condiments.  We know that Dina will reach her goals with a lot of work, effort, and the loans that Edaprospo helps her with.

loans.use: to buy supplies, meat, and condiments.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Ruben tiene 39 años de edad,  vive en la aldea de Nuevos Colorados, ahi vive con sus dos hijos, Ruben se dedica a prestar los servicios de transporte, tiene un taxi, el tiene clientes ya fijos que los transporta de su casa a sus trabajos y viceversa todos los dias. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para el taxi, desea repararlo para dar un mejor servicio, este taxi es su unica fuente de ingresos y Ruben trabaja muy duro para salir adelante con sus dos hijos, es  honrado y responsable, desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ruben is 39 years old.  He lives in the small village of Nuevos Colorados together with his two children.  Ruben provides a transport service.  He has a taxi and regular customers who he transports from their homes to their places of work and back every day.  He will use his loan to buy spare parts for his taxi.  He would like to repair his taxi so that he can provide a better service.  The taxi is his only source of income and Ruben works very hard in order to get ahead in life together with his two children.  He is an honest and responsible man who would like to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil and spare parts

loans.name: Rocío Karina

texts.es:
Rocío una señora trabajadora y empeñosa tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad caracterizada por la exportación de espárragos, alcachofas, entre otros.Roció es casada, y su esposo es obrero, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos tiene  12 años y el mayor 17, ambos se encuentran acudiendo a la escuela.			
Como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo, es así como Rocío encontró una oportunidad de negocio hace ya 4 años e inicio la venta de "Chanfainita" en la esquina de su casa, este negocio le permite ganar S/. 43 Diarios en promedio lo que le ayuda mucho a poder cubrir todos los gastos necesarios para sus niños y para la compra de productos para la venta diaria de la popular “Chanfainita”.

Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla, prestándole S/. 3,000, a mejorar su vivienda ofreciéndoles así a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ella desea poder pagar en 12 meses el total de su crédito.
Esta mejora podrá ayudarla  y así poco a poco podrá cumplir su gran sueño: "Me gustaría mucho tener mi local propio y terminar de construir por completo mi casa”.
texts.en:
Rocío is a hardworking  and enterprising woman. She is 34 years old and lives in the city of Ica. It is characterized by the export of asparagus and artichokes, among other things. Roció is married and her husband is a laborer. They have 3 children between 12 and 17 who are in school. 
			
As is well known, Peru is characterized as having the most delicious food in the world. That is how Rocío found a business opportunity 4 years ago when she started to sell "Chanfainita" at the corner by her house. This business allows her to earn S/. 43 every day on average. It helps her a lot to cover all the necessary expenses for her children and to buy the products to do the daily selling of the popular “Chanfainita”.

At present, she would like the Kiva lenders to help her by lending her S/. 3,000, to improve her home and offer her children a better quality of life. She wants to pay off the loan in full in 12 months. 

This improvement will help her to make her dream come true little by little: "I would really like to have my own locale and completely finish building my house".

loans.use: to do home improvement

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman with two children. She runs a sari-sari store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like eggs, canned goods, and soft drinks. Cirila earns 6000 PHP per month with her business.

Cirila has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, soft drinks, and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Nazaret Group

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Estela es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició trabajando como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al manejo de vehículos pesado.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilo y tintas para el tricotado, espera en el futuro contar con operarios y un mejor capital. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la tejeduría, comercio crianza de animales y al bordado de tejidos.
texts.en:
Lidia Estela is married, 31 years old, and has an elementary school education.  She has 2 children, who are not in school.  Lidia works in weaving, she initially began working as a machinist and so far has 10 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband who operates large vehicles.

Lidia organizes a group to apply for a loan that will be used to purchase yarn and knitting inks.  She hopes in the future to have better workers and capital. The other members work in weaving, animal husbandry and fabric embroidery.

loans.use: to buy yarn and knitting ink.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra de 30 años, casada y con un hijo de 2 años de edad, es la propietaria de una miscelánea donde vende útiles escolares, papelería y accesorio en general, negocio que inició hace 8 años, como producto de los ahorros de su esposo y de ella, cuando trabajó  con su mamá, de quien adquirió el mejor conocimiento del mercado. En su sueño de seguir creciendo, le hace falta un mayor capital de trabajo y desea invertirlo en una temporada de mayor movimiento comercial, como la de fin de años que se acerca, cuyas navidades y año nuevo,  trae consigo la elegancia y distinción de las familias en su buen vestir y en la decoración de su vivienda, con artículos y mercancía general, que Sandra usualmente vende y desea ofrecer en esa temporada. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una fotocopiadora, una vitrina y más mercancía, inversión que planea sea un éxito,  porque le permitirá adicionar un nuevo servicio de fotocopiaje y asegurar en una nueva vitrina un surtido nuevo y bien exhibido, así como productos apropiados para que este fin de año, sus clientes corran a su miscelánea a comprarle y ella pueda ganar,  dinero con su trabajo..
texts.en:
Sandra, age 30, is married and has a two year old son.  She has a general store where she sells school supplies, stationery, and general merchandise.  She started the business eight years ago with the savings that she and her husband had.  When she worked with her mother she gained a better understanding of the market.

Her dream is to continue growing.  She lacks more working capital, and she wishes to invest it for the season; like the approaching end of the year, Christmas, and New Year’s; when there is greater commercial movement.  This season brings with it elegance and distinction when families dress well and decorate their homes with general ornaments.  Sandra usually sells during this time, and she wants to have merchandise to offer.

Her Kiva loan is her first loan that she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy a photocopier, a display case, and more merchandise.  She plans for this investment to be successful because it will allow her to add a new service, photocopying.  It will secure a new display case that is newly stocked and displays the merchandise well.  She will have appropriate products for the end of the years.  Her customers will run to her store to buy from her, she will be able to earn money with her work.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier, a display case, and more merchandise.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is a married woman with eight children. She lives in the town of Trinidad with her family.

Efrena sells gasoline to members of her community. She has had her business for quite some time now. Efrena works hard to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. She hopes to open a sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María emprendedora, trabajadora, comerciante, casada, sus hijos estudiantes, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio. Sus planes son mejorar las condiciones infraestructurales de la vivienda y panadería ya que produce mayores cantidades en comparación al inicio y el espacio pequeño. La panadería es la fuente de ingreso para el hogar colocándose en el campo del comercio desde hace un tiempo. Se le ha presentado como dificultad que al producir más cantidades de pan, ella invierte la ganancia y no existe un fondo de capital que cubra la producción. Inicio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingreso al estar desempleado su esposo y ella, con el conocimiento en la elaboración de panes ellos tenía suficiente base para iniciar la panadería. Necesita el préstamo para construir una habitación destinada para el negocio así                       independizarlo de la casa y obtener mayores beneficios.  Comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, ladrillos, arena, piedrín,  perlines, hierro, golosa, piedras cantera, alambré de amare,  laminas de zinc, verja, reglones de madera, pintura,  entre otros materiales. 
Agradece por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio mediante el financiamiento obtenido. Siendo de gran importancia para el cambio de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, a hardworking, enterprising businesswoman who is married, her children are students, and her husband helps her in her business.  Her plans are to improve the structure of her house and bakery since the she now produces more than when she started and the space is small.  The bakery is the source of income for the family and has given the family a business basis for a time now.  It’s been difficult to produce greater quantities of bread because she has used the earnings so now there is no working capital to cover the production.  She started the business as an income source when she and her husband were unemployed.  They knew how to bake bread so they had the basis to open a bakery.  She needs the loan for a building that will be separate from the house so that it will be more practical.  She will buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, brick, paint, gravel, purlines,  iron, boards, flagstone, construction wire, zinc laminated sheets, wrought iron, paint, etc.
She appreciates the support for her business with the financing since this is very important to change their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Lilyam Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lilyam a sus 47 años de edad es una emprendedora quien inicia su propio negocio con el fin de generar más fuentes de ingresos para su sustento y el de su hijo; la señora Lilyam se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes por catalogo desde hace cuatro años desde su casa. Esta actividad, la señora Lilyam la comenzó con un solo catálogo y actualmente maneja cuatro catálogos.  La señora Lilyam requiere de la compra de surtido de mercancía tal como perfumes y ropa para suplir la demanda de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Lilyam podrá generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y poder cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilyam is a 47-year-old entrepreneur who started her own business so that she could generate more income to support herself and her child. She has been selling clothing and perfumes through catalogs for four years. Lilyam works from home. She says that she started out with only one catalog and now she currently manages four different catalogs.

Sra. Lilyam needs to buy a stock of merchandise, such as perfumes and clothes, so that she can keep up with the year-end demand. With her previous loan, Sra. Lilyam was able to generate more income so that she could improve her quality of life and fulfill her dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 42-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 20, 18, and 11.

Elisa has been growing and selling rice for 20 years. She earns 8000 PHP per month from farming. She has requested a loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Elisa is a hard-working mother. She hopes her children will finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna emprendedora, madre soltera, ama de casa con su negocio de alquiler de cuartos siendo su fuente de ingreso.  Con el préstamo anterior logro cambiar la puerta de uno cuarto que la tenia deterioradas. Generándole mayor comodidad a sus inquilinos. Para este nuevo año tiene como proyecto seguir mejorando las ventanas y puertas de sus habitaciones que  alquila, las paredes y otros descompuestos de la infraestructura de su casa.
Con el préstamo comprara materiales como: puertas,  ventanas, cemento para rellenar algunas partes quebradas, verjas que colocara en ventana y puerta, pintura para aplicarla a las paredes de los cuartos así dándole mejor presentación  al negocio, adquiriendo mayores clientelas y generándole ganancia.  
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo  al desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is an entrepreneur, a single mother, and a homemaker who has a business of renting out rooms as a source of income. With her previous loan, she was able to replace the door of one of the rooms that was in disrepair. This provided more comfort for her tenants. For the upcoming year, she plans to continue making improvements to the windows and doors of each rental unit, the walls, and other parts of the infrastructure of her house that are in need of repairs.

With this loan Reyna will buy materials such as doors, windows, cement for filling up cracks, security grates for the windows and doors, and paint for the walls of the rooms. This will give her business a better appearance and help to acquire more tenants and generate income. Reyna is grateful to the microfinance organization for its assistance with developing her business and improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase materials so that she can continue making improvements to her home.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a hard-working married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 49 years old and has a 21-year-old child.

Jacinto has been farming for five years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell, and he works hard to improve his harvest. 

Jacinto has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He hopes that this loan will help him achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 38-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has five children between the ages of 3 and 19.

Jocelyn is a farmer. She tills her land to plant and harvest rice, which she sells at the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor. Jocelyn is working hard to increase her earnings and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luis a sus 65 años de edad se dedica desde hace más de 30 años a la elaboración de artesanías con barro y a la decoración de materas. Desde Bogotá, el señor Luis trae las materas, las decora en su propio taller y las comercializa en la ciudad de Medellín. El señor Luis desea comprar insumos como el barro, aceites y pinturas y además realizarle adecuaciones a su taller en el piso y paredes. Con lo anterior, el señor Luis podrá mejorar la exhibición de sus productos en su taller y participar en diferentes ferias artesanales en Medellín y Bogotá, asimismo esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y posicionar su negocio y productos. El sueño del señor Luis es poder exportar sus productos al exterior para resaltar el talento colombiano.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is 65 years old and has been producing handicrafts made of clay and decorating pots for more than 30 years. He is from Bogotá, which is where he acquires the pots. He brings them to his own workshop to be decorated and then sells them in the city of Medellín.

Sr. Luis wants to buy supplies such as clay, oil, paints, and other items. He also wants to make structural changes to his workshop by renovating the floor and the walls. With his previous loan, Sr. Luis was able to improve the display of the products in his workshop and to participate in various artisan fairs in Medellín and Bogotá. At the same time, he was able to increase his earnings and promote his business and products.

Sr. Luis dreams of exporting his products abroad in order to showcase Colombian talent.

loans.use: to purchase crafts supplies and to pay for renovations to his workshop.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John Jairo tiene 22 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.

John se dedica a la las actividades de albañil, comercio, ganadería, agricultor. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (ganado) y la alimentación. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá ayudarse ha mejorar la economía de la familia.

El sueño es tener una casa grande de 3 pisos tener un negocio grande, viajar por otro país.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
John Jairo is 22 years old, married, and has no children.  He and his wife live in Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

John is a member is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income. 

John is a bricklayer, merchant, livestock breeder, and farmer.  He buys and sells in Guaranda.  John is requesting a loan to buy animals (livestock) and feed.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve his family’s finances.  His dreams include having a large house with three stories, owning a large business, and traveling to another country.

In his free time, John enjoys the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 47 años de edad es soltera tiene 5 hijos, vive con los hijos de 28, 24, 22 , 18 y 9 años de edad en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Margarita se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembríos de papas además tiene ganado, ovejas, chanchos, terrenos en sembríos y 4 cuadras de terreno y vive en casa propia.
Las comparas y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganados, ovejas y abonos. Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la situación económica de la familia.
El sueño es poder comprar una casa y conocer otra ciudad.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la situación económica, y en la agricultura la sequia  en el verano.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar,  tejer, a veces sale a pasear con la familia y visitar a los familiares lejanos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 47 years old, single, and has five children.  She lives in Guaranda in Bolívar Province with her children (ages 28, 24, 22, 18, and 9).  

Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda.  This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose.  The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.  

Margarita is a farmer who grows potatoes.  She also has cattle, sheep, and pigs.  Margarita has four plots of land on which she grows her crops.  She lives in her own house.  Her purchases and sales are conducted in Guaranda.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle, sheep, and compost.  With the help of this loan, Margarita will be able to improve her family’s financial condition.  Her dream is to buy a house in another city.  The challenges she faces include the economic situation and the summer droughts.  

In her free time, Margarita enjoys relaxing and knitting.  Occasionally she will go out to spend time with her family and visit relatives who live far away.

loans.use: to buy cattle, sheep, and compost.

loans.name: Washington Ruben

texts.es:
Washington Rubén tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Washington se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembríos de papas y ganado. Las compras y las ventas de los productos los realiza en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno, comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas.
Con la ayuda del préstamo utilizará para cambiar la situación económica de la familia.
El sueño es poder comprar un carro y una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los problemas de sequia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y pasar con los hermanos y padres.
texts.en:
Washington Rubén is 20 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother in Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Washington is a member is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.

Washington is a farmer who grows potatoes and raises cattle. He buys his supplies and sells his products in Guaranda. Washington is requesting a loan in order to buy a piece of land, as well as compost, fertilizers, and seeds. With the help of this loan, he will be able to change his family’s financial situation. He dreams of purchasing a car and a house. The challenges he faces include dealing with problems related to drought.

In his free time, Washington enjoys playing sports and spending time with his siblings and parents.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land, as well as compost, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores tiene 32 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.

María se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura.

Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (ganado y ovejas). Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la estabilidad económica.
El sueño es poder comprase una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la sequedad en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar a veces  pasea por la ciudad.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 32 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her mother in Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province.

María Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.

María engages in livestock breeding and farming. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Guaranda. She is requesting a loan in order to buy animals, such as cattle and sheep. With the help of this loan, María will be able to improve her financial stability. Her dream is to buy a house. The challenges she faces include preventing her crops from drying out.

In her free time, María Dolores likes to rest. Occasionally she will spend time in the city.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Monica Yaneira

texts.es: La señora Mónica a sus 39 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizzas, las cuales comercializa en la esquina de su casa los fines de semana gracias a un horno que compró hace varios años. La señora Mónica requiere de la compra de una olla para fritar y un asador para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes, además, necesita comprar materia prima tal como harina, salsas, y verduras. Con lo anterior,  la señora Mónica podrá incrementar sus ingresos y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y cumplir su sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Sra. Mónica is 39 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 18 and 16. She prepares pizzas and sells them on the weekends from the corner of her house. Mónica is able to prepare the pizzas thanks to the oven she purchased several years ago.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a pot for frying and a rotisserie grill so that she can offer a variety of dishes to her customers. In addition, she wants to buy ingredients such as flour, sauces, and vegetables. With her previous loan, Sra. Mónica was able to increase her earnings and provide a better quality of life for her children. This fulfills her dream of being able to give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, a rotisserie grill, and a pot for frying.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her stone quarry, which mines stones and crushes them for gravel and other products. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hammers and other equipment for stone extraction and crushing, and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to open a retail shop. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hammers and other equipment for stone extraction and crushing.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha Beatriz tiene 20 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 3 y 10 meses de edad en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Martha se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, tiene ganado, el vive con la abuela. Las compras y las ventas de los productos de la agricultura lo hace en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la situación económica de la familia.
El sueño es poder cambiar de ciudad donde haya más trabajo. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de agua, sequedad en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, pasar el tiempo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz is 20 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children (ages 3 and 10 months) in Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Martha is a member is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.

Martha is a farmer who grows corn. She also raises cattle at her grandmother’s house. Martha buys her supplies and sells her agricultural products in Guaranda. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and urea. The help from this loan will improve her family’s financial situation. She dreams of moving to a city where there is more work. The challenges she faces include the lack of water, which causes her crops to become dry.

In her free time, Martha likes to relax and spend time with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and urea.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. Four of her children are currently in school. For the past 11 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food products like sugar and cooking oil and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to open another retail shop. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products like sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis Arturo tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos , vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 22, 18, 17, 14 y 12 años de edad en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura vive con la familia, además tiene sembríos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos para la agricultura los compra en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (ganado y chanchos). Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá cambiar la situación económica de la familia.
El  sueño es poder cambiar de ciudad  donde haya más trabajo. Los desafíos que se le ha presentado son en la familia por falta de ingresos.
En los momentos libres le gusta descansar pasar  el tiempo libre con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo is 43 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his wife and children (ages 22, 18, 17, 14, and 12) in Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.

Luis is a farmer who lives with his family and also has crops. He buys his supplies and sells his agricultural products in Guaranda. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy animals, such as cattle and pigs. With the help of this loan, he will be able to change his family’s financial situation. His dream is to move to a city where there is more work. The challenges he faces include dealing with his family’s lack of income.

When he has moments that are free, Luis likes to relax and spend time with his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Maria Juliana

texts.es:
María Juliana tiene 27 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos de 8,4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
María se dedica a la agricultura tiene ganados y sembríos de papas habas fréjol, tiene casa propia. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar ganados y comprar la alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cambiar la situación  económica de la familia.
El sueño es poder cambiar de ciudad donde haya más empleo.
Los desafíos a los que se a enfrentado es la falta de agua en los cultivos por la sequia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, pasar el tiempo con los hijos y visitar a los padres.
texts.en:
María Juliana is 27 years old and is a single mother with three children.  She lives with her children (ages 8, 4, and 2) in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

María is a member of the ‘Pangua’ communal bank, which is based in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu, Guanujo parish, canton of Guaranda.  The community is 15 minutes from the Cooperativa San Jose office.  Most of the members of the ‘Pangua’ group make a living from farming and raising livestock, which they supplement with other activities that allow them to earn extra income, such as retail and construction.     

María makes a living from farming.  She raises cattle and has fields where she grows potatoes and beans.  She has her own house.  She sells her produce in Guaranda.  María is asking for a loan so that she can purchase cattle and food.  With the loan’s help she will be able to improve her family’s economic situation.    

María’s dream is to be able to move to a city where there are more jobs.    

The main challenge she has faced is a lack of water for her crops due to drought. 

In María’s free time she enjoys resting, spending time with her children, and visiting her parents.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and food.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. For the past 6 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, maize, and other products for resale and will help Edward to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to start selling wholesale. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize, and other products for resale.

loans.name: Luz Veronica

texts.es:
Luz Verónica tiene  19 años de edad  es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Luz se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (cerdos, ovejas). Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudaría a cambiar la situación en el estudio. El sueño es poder viajar a otra provincia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es en los cultivos por falta de dinero para comprar los fertilizantes.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y estudiar o a veces ir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
Luz Verónica is 19 years of age.  She is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.
She is a member of the VRC PANGUA, which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu, Parish Guanujo Canton Guaranda.  The community is 15 minutes from the Office.  The majority of the members of the Pangua group are dedicated to Agriculture and stockbreeding and also to other activities where they obtain greater economic income such as commerce and construction.  Luz is dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She requests the loan to buy animals (hogs, sheep).  With the aid of the loan she will be able to change the situation with her studies.  Her dream is to be able to travel to another province.  The challenges that she faces are with her cultivations for lack of money to buy  fertilizers.  In her free time she likes to rest and to study or at times to go for a walk with her parents.

loans.use: to buy animals (hogs and sheep).

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra a sus 36 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 7 años. La señora Sandra tiene un pequeño almacén en su casa desde hace seis años en el cual vende ropa de dama, caballero y niños, con el fin de poder ayudar con los gastos de su familia. La señora Sandra requiere de la compra de mercancía con la cual pueda suplir la demanda de fin de año y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, calidad de vida y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio local independiente de su casa.
texts.en: Sandra is 36 years old and the mother of two children, ages 18 and 7.  She’s had a small store in her house for the past six years, where she sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing so that she can help with the family expenses.  Sandra needs to buy merchandise so that she can meet the end of year demand and increase her income, quality of life, and make her dream of having her own shop outside her home come true.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Anna has been working hard to manage her bar which serves drinks and sodas to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer and soda, and will help Anna to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Anna hopes that in the future she will be able to open another bar. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, James has been working hard to manage his business, which makes bricks. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood fire bricks. This will help James to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. James hopes that in the future he will be able to start a retail shop. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to fire bricks.

loans.name: Segundo Raul

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 39 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 19, 17,12 y 10 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Segundo se dedica a la agricultura siembras de papas havas y además se dedica a la ganadería y también es albañil.
Las comparas y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito  para  comprar animales (cerdos, ovejas). Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la situación de la familia.
El sueño es poder comprar una casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  en los cultivos es la falta de agua porque hay mucha sequia.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo is 39 years old, married and has four children.  He lives in Guaranda, Bolívar province, with his wife and children, ages, 19, 17, 12, and 10.
He’s a member of the Ventanilla Pangua communal bank, located in the Pangua Chaupiyacu community of the Guanujo Cantón Guaranda parish.  It’s 15 minutes from the Ventanilla Pangua’s office.  Most of its members farm, raise livestock, and do other things, like business and construction, where they can earn incomes.

Segundo farms and raises potatoes, beans, and also raises livestock, and works as a mason.

He buys and sells in Guaranda.  He is asking for this loan to buy animals (pigs, and sheep).  This loan will help him to improve his family situation.

His dream is to buy a house.

The challenges he faces are the lack of water for his crops because there is a drought.

He likes to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy livestock
