loans.name: Angel Vinicio

texts.es:
Angel Vinicio tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Angel se dedica a la agricultura y además es albañil . Las compras y las ventas de los productos para la agricultura los compra en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales ganado, oveja y terneros. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la crianza del ganado. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.
En el tiempo libre le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel Vinicio is 24 years old, single and has no children.  He lives with his father in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.

He’s a member of the Ventanilla Pangua communal bank, located in the Pangua Chaupiyacu community of the Guanujo Cantón Guaranda parish.  It’s 15 minutes from the Ventanilla Pangua’s office.  Most of its members farm, raise livestock, and do other things, like business and construction, where they can earn incomes.

Angel is a farmer and also works as a mason.  He buys and sells his agricultural products in Guaranda.  He is asking for this loan to buy livestock, such as sheep and also land.  This loan will help him raise livestock.  He has not had any other problems.

He likes to enjoy the carnival in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy sheep and land.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past twelve years, Alice has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, which sells different kinds of fresh produce. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables to sell in the market. It will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another stall. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
María Laura tiene 24 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos, vive con  el papá y los  hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
María se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembríos de papas, tiene ganado, chanchos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para  comprar  ganado, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del préstamo cambiaría la situación económica de la familia. El sueño es poder comprar terrenos, vivir en otro parte cambiar de ciudad. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de agua en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, pasar el tiempo con los hijos.
texts.en:
María Laura is 24 years old.  She’s single, has two children, and lives with the father of her two children who are 7 and 2 years old. They live in Guaranda, within the Bolívar province.

She’s a member of the Ventanilla Pangua communal bank, located in the Pangua Chaupiyacu community of the Guanujo Cantón Guaranda parish.  It’s 15 minutes from the Ventanilla Pangua’s office.  Most of its members farm, raise livestock, and do other things, like business and construction, where they can earn incomes.

María is a farmer and has potato crops, and pigs.  She buys and sells in Guaranda and is asking for this loan in order to buy livestock, fertilizers, and urea.  Her family’s financial situation will change with this loan.  Her dreams are to be able to buy some land and move to a different city.  The challenge that she faces is the lack of water for her crops.

She likes to relax and spend time with her children in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. He is married and has three children, of whom two are currently in school. For the past six years, Peter has been working hard to manage his workshop, where he manufactures sign posts, doors, and chairs. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wood, metal, and other materials, and it will help Peter to generate greater profits and improve his family's well-being. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to own a large company.

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more wood, metal, and other materials.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: La señora María Inés a sus 45 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 16 años, se dedica desde su pequeño taller ubicado en su casa a la confección de prendas de vestir a sus familiares y conocidos. Este oficio lo realiza la señora María Inés desde hace 20 años. La señora María Inés requiere de la compra una maquina ribeteadora que le permita hacer una mayor cantidad de pedidos  y así mejorar su calidad de vida, obtener mayores ingresos y cumplir su sueño de sacar su propia línea de ropa y darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en: María Inés is 45 years old and the mother of a 16 year old son.  She has a small workshop in her home, where she makes clothing for her friends and family.  María Inés has been doing this for 20 years and needs to buy a sewing machine that will allow her to increase her ability to fill orders and improve her quality of life, increase her income, achieve her dreams of creating her own line of clothing, and provide a good education to her son.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Javier de Jesús, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene un negocio que es la venta de medicamento naturales, tiene bastante competencia pero busca como salir adelante buscando estrategias para poder vender su producto. Javier está solicitando un financiamiento para poder invertir en medicina naturales que son las más buscadas por sus clientes, para ello va comprar: panadol, vitaminas, jarbes, suplementos, dolovitalgia entre otros productos que son los demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: Javier de Jesús, is 37 years old and has a natural medicine business.  He has plenty of competition but he looks for strategies to be able to sell his products.  He is asking for a loan in order to invest in natural medicines, which are sought out by his clients.  He wants to buy Panadol, vitamins, tonics, dietary supplements, among other things that his customers ask for.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María Rosario tiene 43 años de edad es soleta tiene 5 hijos,  vive con la madre y los hijos de 27, 24, 20, 14 y 8 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
María se dedica a la agricultura tiene sembríos de papas, además tiene ganados, ovejas chanchos.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para  comprar ganado, abonos, fertilizantes, urea,  Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar el estili de vida de la familia. El sueño es poder compra una casa. Los desafíos a los que se presenta es la falta de dinero para comprar los insumos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta pensar y tejer, a veces sale a pasear con la familia a visitar a los amigos.
texts.en:
María Rosario is 43 years old, single, and has five children.  She lives with her mother and children, ages 27, 24, 20, and 8.  They live in Guaranda, within the Bolívar province.

She’s a member of the Ventanilla Pangua communal bank, located in the Pangua Chaupiyacu community of the Guanujo Cantón Guaranda parish.  It’s 15 minutes from the Ventanilla Pangua’s office.  Most of its members farm, raise livestock, and do other things, like business and construction, where they can earn incomes.

María is a farmer and has potato crops, pigs, and sheep.  She buys and sells in Guaranda and is asking for this loan in order to buy livestock, fertilizers, and urea.  This loan will help her improve her family’s quality of life.  Her dreams are to be able to buy a house.  The challenge that faces her is the lack of money to buy supplies.

In her spare time she likes think, knit, and sometimes spend time with her family and visiting friends.

loans.use: to buy livestock and fertilizer.

loans.name: Walter Marcelino

texts.es:
El joven Walter tiene 26 años de edad,  vive en la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon, ahi vive con su madre y su hermano, que le ayuda en su negocio, Walter se dedica a la reparacion de motos, tiene un taller de mecanica, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, Walter es responsable en cada uno de sus compromisos de trabajo, cada dia que pasa trata de hacer mejor las cosas y asi crecer con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de repuestos para motocicletas.
Walter es un muchacho de admirar, el trabaja para sacar adelante el hogar de su madre.
texts.en:
Walter is 26 years old and lives in San Marcos de Colon, along with his mother and his brother who helps him with his business.  Walter repairs motorcycles and has a repair shop.  He’s been doing this for the past four years.  Walter is very responsible in all his work commitments.  Each day he tries to make things better and in this way grow his business.

He will use the money from this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts.
Walter is a young man to be admired.  He works to move his mother’s household ahead.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle repair parts and tires.

loans.name: Aotoa

texts.en:
Aotoa is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Samata, Uta. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aotoa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Her main income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Aotoa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month from it.

In 2010, Aotoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities.  Aotoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. The previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Aotoa is now requesting a new loan of 1,400 WST which she will use to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. This will be her second loan from SPBD. She will use the additional revenue that she generates from her business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama is a 55-year-old mother with 4 children.

Malama owns and operates a business venture,selling pancakes in her village.  She has two years of experience in this business. Malama needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase goods such as , flour,sugar , vegetable oil and pots.She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 35 Talas or US $15 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2010, Malama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Malama's second loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as , flour,sugar , vegetable oil and pots.

loans.name: Fuamata

texts.en:
Fuamata is a 21-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Samata I Uta.  She is single and has no children.  To make a living, Fuamata owns and operates a business venture.  The business operates in the services sector.  The main purpose of the business is operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members.  Fuamata has been engaged in this business for over three years.  From these activities, Fuamata earns approximately 1000 WST a month.

In 2010, Fuamata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Fuamata is requesting a loan from SPBD for the second time.  Her previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1350 WST.  The current loan will be used to purchase a new sewing machine.  Fuamata plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Gelgi emprendedora, madre soltera, oficio costurera, el fin del préstamo anterior fue para la compra de materia prima cumpliendo con los pedidos de su clientela. Sus planes ir mejorando poco a poco la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: láminas de plycem, piedras cantera, cementos, tornillos, arena, hierro entre otros materiales para construir un anexo al costado de la casa y darle más seguridad a su familia.
Gracias por el financiamiento que le otorgaron permitiéndole cumplir con parte de los planes a alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gelgi is an entrepreneurial single mother. She works as a seamstress. The purpose of her last loan was to buy raw materials to fulfil orders for her customers. Her plan is to improve gradually the infrastructure of her house. With this loan, she will buy construction materials: plycem sheets, quarry stone, cement, screws, sand, iron among other materials to build an annex on the side of her house providing more security to her family.

She is thankful for the financing that has been given to her permitting her to achieve part of the plans to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Marvin Alexis

texts.es: El señor Marvin tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de san marcos de colon, ahi vive con su madre, Marvin  se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama y caballero, esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año,  el es una persona luchadora y tiene una gran clientela, los productos que les vende son de muy buena calidad y a precios buenos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa al por mayor, se aproxima la epoca de navidad y ya tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes,  trabaja muy fuerte para crecer con su negocio y lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marvin is 29 years old. He lives in the city of San Marcos de Colon. There he lives with his mother. Marvin is dedicated to selling new men's and women's clothing. He has performed this activity for a year. He is a hard-working person and he has great customers. The products that he sells them are of very good quality and good prices. He will use the loan to purchase clothing at wholesale. The Christmas season is approaching and he already has a lot of orders from his customers. He works hard to grow his business and to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase new men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Siatua

texts.en:
Siatua is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Tufutafoe.  She is single and does not have any children.  To make a living, Siatua owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Siatua has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Siatua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Siatua is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time. Siatua is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Siatua plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase toys.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio Antonio tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada que es un negocio bastante reconocido dentro del comercio. Julio tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que todavía esta estudiante, que con mucho esfuerzo a sacado adelante a su familia, es un emprendedor con metas y sueños que desea salir adelante con su negocio que actualmente maneja, su esposa lo apoyo en todo para que ambos salgan adelante. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir  en la compra de  pacas de ropa usada y también en ropa nueva en esta temporada del mes de diciembre que es cuando las ventas están buenas y que su clientela fija y eventuales los visite y brindarles un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Julio Antonio is 39 years old. His economic activity is selling used clothing, which is a rather well-known business in commerce. Julio has three children in his care who still are in school and, with a lot of effort, he has gotten his family ahead. He is an entreprenuer with goals and dreams who wishes to get ahead with his business that he currently manages. His wife supports him in everything so that they both can get ahead. Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of bales of used clothing and also in new clothing in this season of the month of December which is when sales are good and his regular customers, to whom he provides good service, visit.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing as well as new clothing.

loans.name: Leaiti

texts.en:
Leaiti is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Fogapoa. She is married and has six school-aged children. Leaiti makes her living by owning and operating a fishing business. Her main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Leaiti has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1000 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Leaiti joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from SPBD, in the amount of 1000 WST, to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Leaiti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Rosa Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es soltera y vive con una nieta en su casa ubicada en el Caimito, ahi tiene 30 años de vivir, Rosa se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ahorita desea invertir en ropa que es lo que mas se vende para esta epoca, muchos de sus clientes de la pulperia le estan pidiendo ropa y a tomado la decision de invertir en este tipo de producto.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva.
A Rosa le gusta ir a las reuniones de la iglesia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is single and lives with her granddaughter in her house in El Caimito. She has been living there for 30 years. Rosa has a grocery store at her home. Right now she wants to invest in clothing which is what is most sold at this time of the year. Many customers of her grocery store ask her for clothes and so she decided to invest in this type of product. She will use her loan to buy new clothes.

Rosa likes to go to church meetings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women and men.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Fogapoa.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Imeleta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Imeleta has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Imeleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Imeleta is requestinga loan from SPBD  for the first time.  Imeleta is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Imeleta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Sonia sigue con  el local de multiservicios, ella sigue brindando servicios como por ejemplo venta de paquetes turísticas, locutorio, internet y revelado de fotografías. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para fotografias. 

Sonia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (Ella en la fotografía está acompañada de su esposo y una de sus hijas).
texts.en:
Sonia continues to participate in the "Chaska" communal bank of the microfinance institution Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Sonia is still working in her multiservice business where she provides her services such as the sale of tourist packages, telephone service, internet café and photo development. She has already been in this activity for several years and done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. This time Sonia applies for a loan to buy photographic materials.

Sonia is thankful for the opportunity provided by this means and she commits herself to pay off the loan according to the time schedule. (She is pictured with her husband and one of their daughters.)

loans.use: to buy photographic materials.

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en:
Lauiula is a 47 year-old woman living in the town of Satupaitea Satufia.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Lauiula owns & operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Lauiula has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lauiula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lauiula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Lauiula is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicides).  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Lauiula plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicides).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and firewood.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 30 años de edad vive en el barrio Los Ángeles de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí ofrece los servicios de telecomunicaciones a través de llamadas a celulares. Desde el año 2001 comenzó esta actividad con dos planes a celulares a nombre de su madre, quien la apoya en el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos, por quienes Catalina trabaja fuertemente para hacer de ellos unas personas exitosas y poder brindarles cada día más un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad posee 5 planes de celulares, su deseo de crecimiento es muy significativo, y desea tener una carpa, para mejorar la imagen de su negocio, pues en la actualidad cuenta con un parasol  ya deteriorado, que no la protege a ella y a sus clientes de la lluvia. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a asu credkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su meta, más adelante es adecuar un café internet donde amplié su oferta de servicios, en un local bien ubicado en una avenida transitable
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Catalina lives in the Los Angeles neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where she offers telecommunication services via cell phone calls. She began this activity in 2001 with two cell phone plans in her mother’s name. Catalina’s mother helps her support her two children. Catalina works hard for her children, to help them grow into successful adults and to continually improve her ability to provide for their well-being. 

She currently has five cell phone plans, and she has a great desire to grow her business. She would like to have an awning to improve its image; at the moment she has a shade that is worn out and does not protect her and her customers from the rain. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her goal for the future is to establish an Internet café where she can expand her service offerings in a good location on a well-trafficked street.

loans.use: to buy a new awning.

loans.name: Miguel Christian

texts.es:
Miguel sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Miguel sigue estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo en una de las universidades particular de la ciudad del Cusco y está cursando el séptimo semestre. Actualmente, Miguel está trabajando en una de las veterinarias de la ciudad del Cusco. 
En esta oportunidad Miguel requiere el préstamo para pagar su matricula de la universidad.     

Miguel se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miguel continues to participate in the communal back "Chaska" of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.  Miguel continues studying the professional tourism career in one of the universities in the city of Cusco and is in his seventh semester.  Currently, Miguel is working in one of the veterinary clinics in the city of Cusco.  At this opportunity, Miguel needs the loan to pay for his university tuition.  

Miguel finds himself grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and thus, promises to complete his payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Johnis

texts.es: Johnis de 35 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años.  Adquirió experiencia de negocio con su tío y hoy la traduce en su propia microempresa, que comenzó desde hace 6 años;   el comercializa ropa y calzado en muchas líneas, especialmente la deportiva. Sus ventas las realiza en un 50% a crédito y el otro 50% de contado, sus principales clientes están ubicados alrededor de su barrio, son también empleados y comerciantes del centro de la ciudad. Sus aspiraciones de crecimiento son inagotables y hoy está aplicando a un credikiva, con el fin de lograrlo. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará ropa, calzado, y otras mercancías encargadas, para atender la demanda de fin de año, porque hay en el ambiente,  primas y bonificaciones, que recibirán empleados de empresas,  con las que sus clientes no dudarán en hacer los gastos de navidad y año nuevo para que su familia,  especialmente sus hijos tengas ropa nueva en esta época tan linda para las familias.
texts.en: Johnis is 35 years of age and lives in the city of Barranquilla with his partner and their 2 children aged 3 and 5 years. He gained business experience with a uncle and now uses this in his own micro-enterprise which he started 6 years ago. He sells many different types of clothes and footwear, especially sportswear. He sells by cash 50% and by credit 50%. His main customers live around the neighbourhood and are also employees and merchants from the city centre. His aspirations for growth are endless and today he is applying for a loan with Kiva with a view to achieving his goals. This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with it he will buy clothes, footwear and other ordered goods, to handle the end-of-year demand as already there is a feeling in the air that company employees will receive premiums and bonuses which his customers will not hesitate to spend on Christmas and New Year expenses so that their families, especially their children, have new clothes at what is a beautiful time of year for families.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear and other ordered items.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Mauricio a sus 22 años de edad, es un emprendedor quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de fabricación y venta de traperos y escobas en su barrio el Playón ubicado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín. Este oficio el señor Mauricio lo aprendió de su padre quien trabaja en una empresa relacionada con esta actividad. El señor Mauricio requiere de la compra de una maquina ribeteadora y una cortadora y materia prima tal como telas y palos de madera, esto con el fin de poder iniciar su negocio y generar sus propios ingresos para poder estudiar y cumplir su sueño de tener su propia empresa y en ella generar varios empleos directos.
texts.en: Señor Mauricio at the age of 22 years is an entrepreneur who wants to start his own business manufacturing and selling mops and brooms in his neighbourhood called El Playón, located to the north of the city of Medellin. Señor Mauricio learned this trade from his father who works in a company related to this business. Señor Mauricio needs to buy a trimming machine and cutting machine as well as raw materials such as cloth and wooden poles, with a view to starting his own business and generating his own income so that he can study and achieve his dream of having his own company and generating more jobs.

loans.use: to buy a trimming machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene 7 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos de 18, 16, 13, 9, 7,4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAS se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, tiene sembríos de maíz, trigo, cebada, lenteja, cebolla, además tiene 2 ganados lecheros, y se dedica también a la construcción.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para destinarlo a la siembra de maíz  compra de abonos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la producción. El sueño es poder comprar un lote de terreno y construir una vivienda.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es la presencia de lanchas en los cultivos de papas y plagas en el maíz, enfermedades en el ganado.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear, hacer deporte y le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 40 years old, married with 7 children. He lives with his wife and children who are 18, 16, 13, 9, 7, 4 and 2 years old. They live in the Guaranda Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the communal bank VRC VENTANAS which is located in Guantuncoto in the parish of Julio Moreno in the canton of Guaranda, 30 minutes away from the office. The residents of the area work in various sectors such as: agriculture, livestock, animal breeding (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction.

Segundo grows crops and breeds animals. He grows corn, wheat, barley, lentils, onions and in addition has 2 dairy cows. He also works in construction.

He buys and sells in Guaranda. He is asking for the loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop. With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve production. His dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

The challenges he has faced are potato blight and pests in his corn as well as sickness with his cows.

In his free time he likes to go for walks, sports and enjoy the festivities of the carnaval.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Digna Modesta

texts.es:
La  sra. Digna tiene 47 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para alistarse y abrir su negocio, muchos de sus clientes la prefieren ya que la atencion que ella les da es muy especial.
Digna es madre de  4 hijos, mismos que estan mayores de edad y en ocaciones le ayudan con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, embutidos y granos basicos, desea surtir su neogio para la epoca de navidad.
en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
texts.en:
Digna, age 47, sells everyday food products.  She has a grocery store in her house, and she sells all types of staples.  She gets up at five in the morning in order to get ready and open her business.  A lot of her customers prefer her because she gives them very special attention.

Digna has four adult children, and at times they help her with the business.

She will use the loan to buy grocery items like dairy products, sausages, and basic grains.  She wishes to stock her business for the Christmas season.

In her free time she likes to go to church.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like dairy products, sausages, and basic grains.

loans.name: Mavie Patrina

texts.en:
Mavie Patrina is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Faletagaloa.  She is married and has six adult-aged children.  To make a living, Mavie Patrina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Mavie Patrina has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mavie Patrina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mavie Patrina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Mavie Patrina is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.  Mavie Patrina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: German De Jesús

texts.es: El señor German a sus 68 años de edad es padre de cuatro hijos, se dedica desde su propia finca ubicada en el corregimiento de San Félix localizado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín hace más de 20 años a la compra y venta de ganado. Adicionalmente, el señor German vende leche a sus vecinos y familiares. El señor German labora con dos de sus hijos quienes siempre lo apoyan. El señor German requiere de la compra de una novillona y abonos para el terreno de su finca, que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a futuro tener más ganado.
texts.en:
German, age 68, has four children.  He devotes himself to his own farm in San Félix parish to the north of the city of Medellín.  He has been buying and selling cattle for over 20 years.  Additionally, German sells milk to his neighbors and relatives.

German works with two of his children who always support him.

German needs to buy a heifer and fertilizers for the land on his farm.  This will allow him to improve his income and, therefore, improve his family’s quality of life.  It will also allow him to have more cattle in the future.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ime

texts.en:
Ime is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Safua. She is single and has two school-age children.

To make a living, Ime owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her primary source of income from her business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Ime has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Ime joined SPBD to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she is now better able to engage in business activities and hopes to improve her family's living situation. Ime is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. Specifically, Ime is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Ime plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Yeimi

texts.es: Yeimy de 26 años es una joven comerciante que vive en uno de los barrios del sur, más alegres y productivos de la ciudad. Allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, especialmente ropa, cosmético, calzado etc. Su negocio inició cuando procedente del  departamento de Bolívar, hace 13 años, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla y una prima le dio posada e inició ahí mismo su vida productiva, para ayudarle a responder con los gastos de la casa. A su prima le debe toda su experiencia,  pues ella  le enseñó a comercializar productos, debido a que se dedicaba a ello. Primero vendía cremas y pequeñas mercancías, pero cuando hizo su propio capital, se independizó y gradualmente adicionó ropa, telas, calzado,  y todo lo que sus clientes le piden, pues para fidelizarlos siempre está atenta a responder a sus gustos,  intereses y necesidades. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento es inagotable y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, para lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo y abrirse a una nueva clientela, porque  ante la creciente demanda, el dinero que recoge de los pagos que le hacen sus clientes, no es suficiente para responder a su mercado. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará ropa, productos de tocador, que han sido encargados por sus clientes, a propósito de la temporada del año más activa comercialmente: el final del año. Tradicionalmente Yeimi sabe que es una buena época, para expandirse en el mercado,  porque hay mucho dinero circulante y el alta la probabilidad de vender muy rápidamente.
texts.en:
Yeimy, age 26, is a young businesswoman who lives in one of the southern neighborhoods.  It is one of the happiest and most productive neighborhoods in the city.  She has a business there, and she sells various merchandise.  She mostly sells clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, etc. 

Her business started when she left the Bolivár department and arrived in the city of Barranquilla.  A cousin gave her lodging, and her productive life started right there in order to help with the household expenses.  She owes all of her experience to her cousin, who taught her to sell products because her cousin did the same thing.

At first she sold creams and small merchandise.  When she had her own capital she became independent and gradually added clothes, fabric, shoes, and everything her customers request.  In order to cultivate their loyalty she always responds to their tastes, interests, and needs.  

Her current dream of growing is tireless.  That is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan to augment her working capital and to get new customers.  In the face of the growing demand the money that she receives from her customers is insufficient to respond to her market. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy clothes and toiletries, which her customers have ordered.  Her plan is for the most commercially active time of the year, New Year’s.  Yeimi knows that this is traditionally a good time to expand in the market.  There is a lot of money in circulation, and there is a high probability of selling very quickly.

loans.use: to buy clothes and toiletries, which her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Leauga

texts.en:
Leauga is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Sataua Tai. She is married and has six adult-age children.

To make a living, Leauga owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her primary main source of business income comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Leauga has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,200 WST per month from these activities.

In 2010, Leauga joined SPBD to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she is better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's living situation. Leauga has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 1,000 WST from SPBD. That prior loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Leauga is now requesting another loan, again in the amount of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase a weed killer and other farming supplies. The loan would be her second loan from SPBD. Leauga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a weed killer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 20-year-old woman living in the town of Sasina. She is single and does not have any children.

To make a living, Sina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector by running a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, her primary source of business income comes from selling a variety of different products in her local community. Sina has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,800 WST per month from these activities.

In 2010, Sina joined SPBD to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her living situation. Sina has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 1,000 WST from SPBD. The prior loan was used to purchase goods for the shop. Sina is now requesting another loan, again in the amount of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase a refrigerator, canned foods, freezers, and snack food for everyday use. Sina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, canned foods, freezers, and snack food

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria del Carmen tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta comidas, como ser  desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas durante todo el dia, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona donde transitan muchas personas y esto hace que su negocio tenga buenas ventas, muchos clientes la prefieren ya que elabora las comidas con buen sabor y los precios de venta son accesibles.
Maria nos comento que le a tocado dificil salir adelante con su familia mas sin embargo a logrado a estabilizar su negocio y su economia.
Su deseo es terminar de pagar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 41 years old, she is a single mother and she engages in selling breakfast and lunch meals and sweets all day long. Her stall is located in a popular area, where many people pass by, so she is able to make a lot of sales. Her shop has many customers who prefer her as she prepares tasty food and sells them at affordable prices.
Maria told us it has been hard for her to provide for her family but that she has nonetheless succeeded in steadying her activity and her savings.
She wishes to finish paying for her house.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken meat, sausages, curd, butter, cheese, noodles, rice, tortillas, oil, drinks, dressings, water, vegetables, dishes and glasses.

loans.name: Javier Adan

texts.es: El señor Javier a sus 56 años se dedica desde hace cuatro años a prestar el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares; con este negocio el señor Javier genera un empleo directo a su sobrino y puede tener más tiempo libre para dedicarse a otras actividades puesto que anteriormente el señor Javier tenia una tienda la cual era muy esclavizante. El señor Javier requiere de la compra de una lavadora para reponer una que esta en mal estado. Con lo anterior el señor Javier podrá mejorar su servicio, aumentar sus ventas y así tener una buena calidad de vida y a futuro cumplir su sueño de tener más lavadoras y atender a más clientes.
texts.en: Javier is 56 years old. For four years he has rented out washing machines to his neighbors, friends and family. With this business, Javier generates direct employment for his nephew and can have more free time to spend on other activities. Previously, Javier had a store and it was very enslaving. Javier needs to buy a washing machine to replace one that is in poor condition. Thus, Javier will be able to improve his service, increase his sales and have a good quality of life. in the future, he will be able to make his dream come true of having more washing machines and serving more customers.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and do equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Lucy Ediltrudys

texts.es:
La Señora Lucy es socia del banco comunal Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y gastronómica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y gentil.

Doña Lucy tiene 43 años, es separada de su esposo y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años de edad, todos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora. Lucy se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mariscos desde hace 2 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pescado, camarones, langostinos, cangrejos, etc. para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Lucy is member of the Esmeraldeñas communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has great cultural, natural and gastronomic wealth. Since December, 1999, it has been a World Heritage Site. Its people are friendly and kind.  

Lucy is 43 years old. She is separated from her husband and from her marriage has 3 children, aged 22, 20 and 18. All of them work and help her financially. She doesn't own her own home and rents. 

Lucy has sold all types of seafood for 2 years. She works Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule. 
 
This is her first loan with the communal bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She is going to invest it in buying fish, prawn, shrimp, crab, etc. to grow her business. 
 
Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy fish, prawns, crab, etc.

loans.name: William Jose

texts.es: William casado, su hijo estudia, sus planes a corto plazo es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que habita en una zona de alta delincuencia. Trabaja para una empresa privada desempeñando el cargo de técnico.  Con el préstamo que solicita comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques, estribu, alambre de amarre, hierro, clavos, lamina de zinc, goloso perlines, soldadura entre otros materiales para construir un cuarto. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de la mejora de su nivel de vida obteniendo seguridad y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en: William is married. His daughter goes to school. HIs short term plans are to improve the infrastructure of his home, since he lives in a high crime area. He works for a private company as a technician. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy construction materials: cement, sand, gravel, blocks, bars, zinc sheeting, and soldering, among other things to build a room. He is grateful to the bank for the support it has given in the development of his improving quality of life and comfort for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Victoria Yadira

texts.es:
La Señora. Victoria es socia del banco comunal Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y gastronómica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y gentil.

La Señora. Victoria tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre y no tiene hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la venta de mariscos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, trabaja 4 días de la semana y para vender sus productos tiene una carreta y vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  víveres para su negocio.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
Señora Victoria is a member of the communal bank Esmeraldeñas. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that is rich in culture, gastronomy and natural delights which since December 1999 has been a cultural heritage site. Its people are friendly and polite.

Señora Victoria is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has no children. Her husband works selling seafood. Thye do not own their own house and live in rented accomodation. She makes and sells food. She works 4 days a week and she uses a handcart from which to sell her products as she travels around the city.

She has been a member of the communal bank for the last year and she will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of food supplies for her business. Her goal is to finish building her house which is currently under construction.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Segunda Celia

texts.es:
La Señora. Segunda es socia del banco comunal Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y gastronómica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y gentil.

Doña Segunda tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos hijos menores en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Segunda se dedica a la venta de mariscos y labora 4 días de la semana, trabaja en esta actividad hace 10 años y labora desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
  
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pescado, camarones, cangrejos, langostinos, etc.
 
Su meta es  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Segunda is a member of the Esmeraldeñas communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with great cultural, natural and gastronomic  wealth. It's people are friendly and kind.

Segunda is 30 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children, aged 14, 11 and 8. Her oldest daughter goes to high school, and her two youngest children go to a little school in town. She doesn't own her own home, so she rents.  
 
Segunda sells seafood. She works 4 days a week. She has done this for 10 years and works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. 
  
She has been a member of the bank for a year and she will invest her new loan in buying fish, shrimp, crab, prawns, etc.
 
Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, crabs, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Nevis

texts.es: Nuvis  de 25 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 2 años en un barrio ubicado al sur de la ciudad. Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancías variadas, a través de guías especializadas o catálogos y también vende aliños.  Su negocio lo inició en el año 2009, con un capital que le dio su cónyuge, quien trabajaba como conductor de buses. Como su madre se dedicó a la venta de aliños tienda a tienda, desde muy niña la acompañaba en esta labor y absorbió su mayor experiencia de este desempeño; así que cuando organizó su hogar no dudó en generar ingresos para apoyar el bienestar, realizando la misma actividad. En la actualidad ha logrado muchos clientes y ha diversificado su oferta de productos, así como también se ha extendido por toda la ciudad. Su afán de crecimiento para aumentar el bienestar de su familia, la lleva a trabajar diariamente para aumentar sus ingresos, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para responder a la creciente clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para los aliños y productos que para esta temporada han venido en los catálogos con importantes descuentos, que trasladará a sus clientes, como su mejor oferta del año y ella  con esta inversión ganará un poco más de dinero.
texts.en:
Nuvis, 25, lives with her husband and two year old son in a barrio located south of the city. There she sells general merchandise by catalogs and she also sells seasonings. She started her business in 2009 with capital given to her by her husband, who works as a bus driver. Nuvis acquired a great deal of experience in this endeavor, since as a very young child she accompanied her mother, who sold seasonings store to store. Consequently when she organized her own home, she knew she would generate income to help support her family by performing the same work. 

Currently she has attracted many customers and has diversified her product offerings and has also extended her sales area throughout the entire city. Her eagerness to expand her business in order to increase her family’s well-being inspires her to work every day to raise her income; however her working capital is insufficient to respond to her growing clientele. For this reason she has come to Kiva for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funding to buy basic supplies for her line of condiments  and also seasonal products in the catalogs that are being offered at important discounts, savings she will pass on to her customers as her best offer of the year. With this investment she will earn a little more money.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for her seasoning line and also products being offered during the holidays by catalog.

loans.name: Luis Wilhelm

texts.es:
Luis sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luis sigue dedicándose a promover eventos culturales y sociales. Luis también sigue con el pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de comida.  Actualmente,  Luis ha creado una página web donde se brinda servicios de radio y tv. (www.voce.pe)
En esta oportunidad Luis requiere el préstamo para seguir implementando la pagina web.    

Luis se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luis continues participating in the Chaska communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. He continues promoting cultural and social events and also involved in the small family business that consists of food sales. Currently Luis has ceated a web page where he offers his radio and tv services (www.voce.pe).  This time Luis needs a loan to continue running his web page.

Luis is grateful for the opportunity provided him through this loan and promises to comply with the scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to continue running his web page.

loans.name: Ferney Alonso

texts.es: El señor Ferney a sus 28 años de edad es propietario de un bar el cual reabrió hace dos meses luego de haber tenido que cerrarlo debido a dificultades familiares. El señor Ferney tiene este negocio con el fin de obtener ingresos adicionales para apoyar a su familia. El señor Ferney trabaja los fines de semana en su negocio y los días hábiles trabaja en una empresa. El señor Ferney requiere de la compra de surtido tal como licor, snacks y gaseosas, sillas y mesas para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Con lo anterior, el señor Ferney podrá mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales podrá costear sus estudios y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ferney at 28 is the proprietor of a bar which reopened two months ago after having been closed due to family difficulties. He owns this business in order to earn additional income for his family.  He works weekends in his business and weekdays for a company. 

Ferney needs to purchase supplies such as liquor, snacks and soft drinks and chairs and tables so he can offer his customers better service. With a loan, he will be able to improve his income and thus finance his studies and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tables and chairs

loans.name: Lercy

texts.es: Lercy es una confeccionista que tiene mucha calidad en sus prendas, ella se esmeró y lo aprendió en su proceso de formación en diseño de modas, iniciado cuando llegó desde Ayapel, municipio donde nació en el departamento de Córdoba, el departamento ganadero por excelencia. Para Lercy, madre de dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 19 años, no todo ha sido fácil, ella debió esmerarse por responder a los desafíos que la vida le propuso y con su negocio de confecciones, ha logrado salir adelante. Desde  hace 15 años inició con su negocio de confecciones después de haber estudiado, confeccionando ropa sobre medidas de sus primeros clientes, que estaban conformados por sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, posteriormente ha logrado perfeccionar su arte hasta convertirlo en su mejor empresa, pues no solo genera ingresos que apoyan el bienestar de su hogar sino también genera empleos, porque con ella trabajan dos mujeres,  que hacen parte de sus operaciones; aunque Lercy es quien más trabaja, pues como ella dice, no tiene horarios. En la actualidad aunque atiende a clientes uno a uno, sobre medidas, también posee contratos con colegios, en la ciudad y en su natal Ayapel.  Su infraestructura ha ido poco a poco creciendo, de su máquina sencilla, ha pasado a tener 3 industriales y en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará una máquina industrial para optimizar los tiempos productivos y aumentar su producción, así mismo invertirá en telas para hacer los vestidos de grado productos de un contrato que ganó en el departamento de Cordoba.
texts.en: Lercy is a garment manufacturer whose garments are of high quality. She worked hard and learned the trade while studying fashion design when she arrived from the municipality of Ayape in the department of Cordobal, where she was born. Cordoba is well-known for its livestock rearing par excelence. Not everything has been easy for Lercy, a mother of 2 children aged 9 and 19 years. She had to work hard to overcome life's challenges and with her garment business has managed to get ahead. She started her business 15 years ago after finishing her training, sewing made-to-measure clothes for her first customers who were her neighbours, friends and relatives. Subsequently she perfected her craft to set up her best company as it not only generates income which ensures the well-being of her household but also generates jobs as 2 women work for her and form a part of her operations; although Lercy is the one who works the most as she says she has no schedule. Currently alhtough she sees clients one-on-one, about measurements, she also has contracts with schools in the city and in her native Ayapel. Her infrastructure has grown little by little, from her simple  sewing machine to having 3 industrial type machines. She is currently applying for her first loan with Kiva with which she will buy an industrial type machine to optimize production times and increase production. She will also invest in fabrics to make grade dresses, garments for a contract she won in the department of Cordoba.

loans.use: to buy an industrial type machine to optimize production time.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella sigue dedicándose a la promoción de venta de productos naturales y sigue también dedicándose a la venta de ropa. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

En esta oportunidad Marco Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa. 

Marco Antonio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio continues to participate in the Asociación Arariwa’s “Chaska” communal bank in the city of Cusco. He continues to make his living by selling natural products and clothing. For the past four years, he has been in this business, and it is going very well for him due to the effort he puts into his work. 

At this time, Marco Antonio needs the loan to purchase merchandise, such as clothing.

Marco Antonio is appreciative for the opportunity provided by this means and also he commits to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as clothing.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Aristides sigue dedicándose a la venta de artesanía y ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Aristides requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo artesanía.    

Aristides se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Aristides continues to participate in the “Chaska” communal bank, pertaining to the Arariwa Associacion in the city of Cusco.

Aristides still sells artisan crafts and clothing. For various years now he has dedicated himself to this business and it is going very well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. On this occasion, Aristides needs a loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, artisan crafts.

Aristides is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this medium, and also, he is committed to compliance with the prescribed schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy merchandise, including, for example, artisan crafts to sell.

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es: Miluska sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Miluska sigue dedicándose a la venta de vehículos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Miluska requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa.
texts.en:
Miluska continues to participate in the “Chaska” communal bank, pertaining to the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

Miluska is still selling vehicles. She has done this for various years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. On this occasion, Miluska needs a loan to carry out maintenance on her home.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Fortunata sigue dedicándose a la elaboración  de manualidades ósea teja chompas para niños, bebes, damas y caballeros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos y otros materiales más.
texts.en:
Fortunata continues her participation in the Chaska communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Fortunata continues making handicrafts.  She knits sweaters for children, babies, women, and men.  She has been in this business for several years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Fortunata now needs the loan to buy materials like wool, thread, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy materials like wool and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, vive en el cantón Sigsig en  que está ubicado al Suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene atractivos turísticos como su Museo Arqueológico Municipal, productos artesanales de paja toquilla, producción agrícola y frutícola de excelencia la cual ha llevado a sus productores a realizar anualmente festivales y concursos para designar a las mejores plantaciones y producción de manzana especialmente.

Doña Rosa tiene 65 años, es casada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, 8 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, actividad que la realiza desde una muy corta edad ya que el oficio aprendió de sus padres, también se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas y alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es tener un criadero más grande de animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of  “Las Toquilleras” (The Knitters) communal bank and lives in Sigsig canton, located southeast of Cuenca city. It has tourist attractions such as the Municipal Archeological Museum, artisan products woven from  the local reeds, and excellent agricultural production and fruits, leading growers to hold annual festivals and competitions to select the best plantations and producers, especially of apples.

Rosa is 65 years old, married, and the union has conceived 9 children, all of whom are now adults. Eight are married and living independently. Her single daughter studies at a little school in the locality. Rosa's husband is dedicated to agriculture. They own their own home.

Rosa makes hats from the local reeds, an activity she has done since a very young age. She learned the trade from her parents. Rosa also raises guinea pigs, hens and pigs, and sells them when the economic need arises.

Rosa is in her 3rd loan cycle through her communal bank, and she will use the loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and feed for her animals.

Rosa's goal is to have a larger breeding place for her animals.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and hens to raise, plus feed for her animals.

loans.name: Mónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Las Toquilleras, vive en el cantón Sigsig en  que está ubicado al Suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene atractivos turísticos como su Museo Arqueológico Municipal, productos artesanales de paja toquilla, producción agrícola y frutícola de excelencia la cual ha llevado a sus productores a realizar anualmente festivales y concursos para designar a las mejores plantaciones y producción de manzana especialmente.

La Señorita Mónica tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres en una casa que es propia, su papá labora en el área de la construcción y su mamá en la cría de animales.
 
Ella por el momento está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad, es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de calzado para iniciarse en la venta de esta mercadería y tener un negocio propio.
 
Su meta es continuar con sus estudios hasta llegar a ser profesional en la carrera de Administración de Empresas.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the "Las Toquilleras" communal bank. She lives in the canton of Sigsig, located southwest of the city of Cuenca. It has tourist attractions such as its Municipal Archaeological Musuem, handicraft products made from toquilla fiber, and high-quality farm and fruit products, leading its producers to hold annual festivals and competitions to design the best plantations, especially in apple production. 

Mónica is 18 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in a house that they own. Her father works in construction, and her mother raises animals. 
 
At present, Mónica is studying at a school in her town. She has been a member of the communal bank for a year, and she will invest her new loan in buying shoes so she can start selling this kind of merchandise and have a business of her own. 
 
Her goal is to continue her studies to become a professional with a degree in Business Administration.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
Santos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en la   Caserío CP-3 del Distrito de Tambogrande, correspondiente a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Santos vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la venta de pescado, actividad por la cual lo conocen en la zona, por la calidad  de sus productos y la buena atención a sus clientes.  Él recorre toda su zona donde tiene clientela conocida. Las personas lo estiman y admiran por su empuje y su sentido de superación a su corta edad.  Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres y a la vez financia sus gastos personales.

Santos desea comprar más pescado para incrementar sus ventas diarias y así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Santos is 22 years old. He is single and does not have children.  He lives with his parents in the CP-3 area, in the district of Tambogrande, Piura region, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of Lambayeque state.  Santos lives in a rural area and only has electrical service.

Santos sells fish and is known in the area for the quality of his products and his good customer service.  He has customers throughout the entire area.  People like him and admire him for his efforts and desire to get ahead at such a young age.  He uses the income from this work to help his parents and cover his personal expenses.

Santos wants to buy more fish to increase his daily sales, thus growing his business and ultimately improving his quality of life.  For this purpose he has requested a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: ro purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase groceries for sale.

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: Meyling emprendedora, comerciante tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y variedades laborando por cuenta propia. Sus planes es ampliar su negocio mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda darle mejor futuro a sus hijos. Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo invertirá en la compra de mercadería ya que para estos tiempos de fiesta navideña se aumenta las ventas. Los productos que comprar son: ropa para dama, caballero, niños, zapatos, bisuterías, prendas de oro, oro laminado, plata (anillos, pulseras, aretes, etc.) entre otras mercadería para ofrecerle variedades a su clientela. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo continuo al desarrollo de su negocio y mejoramiento de su nivel de vida poco a poco.
texts.en: Meyling is an entrepreneur.  She is a merchant and has her own business selling clothes and other items.  Her plans are to grow her business, improve the condition of her home, and provide a better future to her children.  With this new loan she will purchase merchandise as sales increase during the Christmas holidays.  She will purchase clothing for women, men and children, shoes, jewelry, gold and gold plated items, and silver (rings, bracelets, earrings, etc.), among other things, to provide selection to her customers.  She thanks the bank for its ongoing support of the development of her business and for the step by step improvement to her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman who has three children. Mary Jean is 33 years old and resides at Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 
Mary Jean owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Mary Jean is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Mary Jean wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is from the village of Santa Cruz, Kapatagan, lanao del Norte. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business in her local community, selling a variety of products . She has been in the business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month.

In 2011, Luisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Luisa is requesting her second loan, in the amount of 10,000 PHP, to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital.

location.town: Santa Cruz, kapatagan, lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He tills his own land to plant rice crops. Jose sells his harvest to rice traders. He is able to provide for his family through farming. Jose works hard to improve his earnings and his family's living conditions.

Jose is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. He hopes this loan will help him achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 49 years old, is married and comes from Kinuman, Ozamis City. Susan has been farming for 4 years, earning PHP 10,000 a month. In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be Susan's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jenevive

texts.en:
Jenevive is from the village of Kinuman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and married, with three school-aged children.

Jenevive owns a lot where she has farmed for over 8 years, earning approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Jenevive is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer.

In 2011, Jenevive joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situations. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Adolfo Salvador

texts.es:
Adolfo es un hombre soltero de 22 años, el se dedica al negocio de taxista, eligio este negocio porque le parece que es muy rentable y económico, Adolfo es un hombre trabajador, empeñoso y muy luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante,empezó en el negocio desde hace 2 años, gana semanalmente un promedio de S/. 310 soles .
Con el crédito que se le otorgará gracias a Kiva de S/. 1600.00 soles lo invertirá para hacerle mantenimiento general a su taxi, uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa para que en un futuro no muy lejano tuviese una mejor calidad de vida.
Adolfo vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a 22 year old single man. He works in the taxi driving business. He chose this business because he thinks it is very profitable and affordable. Adolfo is a hardworking, persevering man, a real fighter with a strong wish to get ahead. 

He started in the business 2 years ago and currently earns a weekly average of S/. 310. He will invest the S/. 1600.00 loan that he will receive thanks to Kiva in the general maintenance of his taxi. One of his dreams is having his own house, so that he can enjoy a better quality of life in the not very distant future.
